pageName: Clarks Women's Orinoco Club Short Shaft Boots
text: I ordered these as I already have 2 pairs (starting to look a bit faded). Thought I'd treat myself when they dropped in price. I could barely get my foot in them! Checked I hadn't ordered the wrong size and no they were showing correct. Irrespective my foot would not slip in - felt like that scene in The Nutty Professor when he's blowing up and his feet look like fat sausages! I have never tried on a narrower boot in my life. Couldn't work it out, same boots same size but nope my feet were not going in. I have since bought the same boots same size via Ebay (new and same price) and they fit like my other pairs fit! I've no idea why these are ridiculously narrow but unless you have super skinny feet then these are not for you.

pageName: Clarks Women's Orinoco Club Short Shaft Boots
text:
I have returned one pair already because it looked like a person with a large foot had tried on one of mine and stretched it before I received them.

Now I have returned a second pair because I have given up! After one fairly long walk, once, the first time I wore them, these boots stretched out and went all bumpy and horrible! Exactly like the photo shown in one of the 1* ratings on here. I think some non-Clarks counterfeits could be among the stock of these boot styles.

Initially I thought: They are beautiful but narrow, which is fine for me, but it means I was sent a slightly stretched pair which had been tried on by someone with a wider foot and now they look uneven..

The first Black size 7 I ordered were in PERFECT contition but I couldn't tell if they were real leather and could withstand UK winter weather so I returned them and asked in the Q&A if they were definitely real leather... they are - 'nubuck' to be precise!

So, regretting my decision to return them that afternoon, I immediately re ordered another Black size 7.... sadly, although the soles are clean and label intact, the left foot has definitely been stretched and developed a crease from someone with a wider foot having tried it on and bent their foot in it. With such a sleek, slim fitting style, the wear is immediately noticeable. I have taken a leap of faith in re ordering another Black size 7 pair while I return these...

Looking at the reviews it seems people either LOVE keep these or return them for being to narrow so I really hope I get a fresh - totally unworn, not even 'tried on pair' FINGERS CROSSED!

(I have since updated this as things progressed)
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
 Nice initially but poor quality - previous customer must have stretched one of mine!

pageName: Clarks Women's Orinoco Club Short Shaft Boots
text:
These can be very comfortable but they are sized on the small and narrow side. I bought a size 7 (my normal size) which were too narrow and pinched my toes - I had to send them back! I got a size 7.5 instead and these fit really well. However, if you have wider than average feet you may still find these boots uncomfortable.

I wear these as everyday work-shoes: they normally last me ~1 year of heavy use (this is my second pair).
If you get the sizing right, they are comfortable, waterproof, lightweight, and well-made boots. One draw-back is that they are not particularly warm in winter and are too tight to allow the wearing of very thick socks.

I was initially put off by the absence of laces - don't be! These are so easy to slip on and off and you never need worry that your laces have come undone and are being dragged through all the dirty street puddles (believe me, this is a game-changer).

Visually, these are very attractive boots: sleek, well-shaped, real leather, and a lovely midnight blue (almost but not quite black).

4.0 out of 5 stars
 Great all-rounder boots- BUY HALF A SIZE BIGGER THAN YOU NORMALLY WEAR!!!

pageName: Clarks Women's Orinoco Spice Ankle Boots
text: I do not have wide feet and I could barely get these on my feet. I imagine that they'll need a lot of wearing in and that in the process of wearing them on I will potentially REALLY hurt the bridge across my feet. The only way I would wear these out is in I took a spare comfortable pair of slip ons for the eventual pain I will be in. pageName: Clarks Women's Orinoco Spice Ankle Boots
text:
These are great boots. They are leather - the ones I have are the matte black. The fit is perfect for me as I have a shallow instep and usually need boots laced up tight (I don't with these). The side zip makes it easier to get them on (although this part was quite snug, even for me) and you don't have the faff of undoing the laces. However, if you are anything above a slim to standard width I think these boots would be too tight unless you buy a wide fitting. I normally find a 7.5D fits in a Clarks shoe, but bought these in an 8D as it was all they had and they are perfect.
The leather is soft but there is plenty of support and the boots are quite sturdy. I have worn these for work and been on my feet for eight hours in them and found them comfortable. They were a good price too, compared to Clarks own website.

pageName: Clarks Women's Orinoco Spice Ankle Boots
text:
I was SO looking forward to receiving these boots (I was so in love with them online that I bought TWO pairs!!) - but what a disappointment?!!!
I'll start with the 'BAD'....
THEY ARE RIDICULOUSLY SMALL!
I have worn Clarks footwear - of all shapes and styles - in 7.5D, for YEARS! To allow for thicker socks, and having read a lot of reviews saying they came up small/narrow, I ordered a size 8 (8wide not available, and 9 seemed excessive).
I felt like an 'ugly sister', trying to force my feet into a boot that felt like it was a size 6!!!!
Wore them around the house for HOURS trying to warm them up and to stretch them a bit but the the LENGTH was ALWAYS going to be too short....
Finally gave in and, with a broken heart, returned both pairs!!????
BUT... I must say, they are GORGEOUS BOOTS!! Albeit a bit stiff! This would obviously soften in time, so not a problem for me.
I LOVED the fact that you could customise the fit with the laces, and then pop them on and off using the side zip - genius!
They look great - really wanted the chunky military look, but with a feminine twist- and these boots are just that. The shape of the toe means they don't look particularly 'manly'.. !!
Overall, I was HUGELY disappointed at the FIT of these boots - NOT a 'classic' sizing, they felt like they weren't sized for the european market - but the style and design are BEAUTIFUL!!!
Although they weren't built for ME don't let that put you off! If you have a NARROW foot, give them a go!!!

pageName: Clarks Women's Orinoco Spice Ankle Boots
text:
I'm not one to write reviews usually but have just bought my second identical pair of these because I liked the first pair so much.
I ask a lot from my boots - gardening, walking, DIY, handling animals, etc. These boots have held up incredibly well. I wouldn't go wading through puddles in them as there is a zip to the inside, but generally wearing them around on a rainy day I've never gotten wet feet, even bringing animals in and out from the field. I've even ridden in these when I can't find (or can't be bothered looking for) my riding boots.
I have moderately wide feet, and suffer with arthritis in my ankles. I have found these very comfy and the fact that I can tighten and loosen the laces for the right fit and level of support is great. The zip is great quality and very handy, no need to fiddle with the laces every time I put them on, they're pretty much pre-set. However if I want to adjust them because of thicker socks or something, it only takes a sec.
The first pair are still structurally perfect after a year and a half of daily (hard) wear. Only reason I bought a second pair is that the first ones now have paint, grout and who knows what else on them. I will keep that pair for rough work and my new pair for when I need to look a bit more presentable. They look lovely with jeans and a jumper.
10 out of 10 would recommend.

5.0 out of 5 stars

pageName: Clarks Women's Cora Rouched Ankle Boot
text:
I keep giving Clark's a chance, which always feels like a hit or miss outcome. This was a fail for me. For some items, like Clark's lug-soled loafers, it was a win! But for these boots, not so much. Part of this is due to my own foot issues. I have big feet for my 5'3" inch, 100lb body. Those women's size 8.5-9.5 feet jut out in front of me in some shoes like clown feet, if there is a large bulbous toe on the offending footwear. And alas, there was such a clown toe peering back up at me from the floor when I tried these on. No offense to clowns, but I'm not aiming for the circus performer look and I don't want a part time gig doing kid's birthday parties as a clown.

I'd rather the whole shoe was the same width, rather than this rounded bulb at the end. It just looks weird. Personally, I gave these a try because I can't get too narrow of a shoe. I have a bunion and a "Morton's toe" which is a longer toe that cramps up in some shoes. Hence, I'm super picky about footwear. I wanted to like these, because they appeared like they might not pinch my bunion. But too much shoe is too much shoe. The shoe fit, but it had issues, at least for me, given my ugly feet.

And to add to my bad foot issues, not only do I have big feet, I have very small ankles, about 7.5" circumference. There was so much gapping at the top of those boots, I'm not sure any sock could fill the void and I'd worry about ankle discomfort when it rubbed against them.

Plus, even when I put wide legged pants over this and I'm talking the largest, widest leg pants I own, (which happen to be the flowing Free People's Old West Slouchy Jeans) the top of the boot just kept bunching up in the material of the jeans or protruding like I was hiding an very small, but noticeable extra terrestrial alien in my pant legs.

Thoughts: If you have smaller feet, you'll have less circus performer appearance with these. Less shoe is less clown look. If you have normal sized ankles or wider ankles or want to wear these over leggings, it might work for you. I've moved away from leggings and jeggings, personally. I need a boot that fits well under a straight legged, flair legged and wide legged jean and these will not work for me there. (I would assume that was likely that due the size of the shoe, causing the opening for the ankle to also be larger, might not be your issue with them if you wear a smaller size.)

As for comfort, they have the typical Clark's decent softness inside. But I just could not find them to be keepers for me. I got an 8.5, which is my smallest normal size and they fit me properly, except for the issues I had above. Given that, I'd assume they run true to size.

text:
These boots are amazing! I bought out of practicality, but they actually look nicer than I thought they would.

But the real deal is the comfort and practicality! As a teacher, I need inserts in every shoe I own... not these. They hug and support my feet beautifully. By far the most comfortable shoes I have ever taught in. Then, it started to snow, and I had the very pleasant surprise of figuring out that if these aren't waterproof, they are at least water resistant, and WARM! I had to de-snow/ice my car for about 20 minutes yesterday, standing in 5 inches of snow, and my feet felt no cold. Amazing. Would buy again and again and again!

pageName: Crocs Women's Classic Neo Puff Shorty Boot W Snow
text:
Really looking forward to receiving these. I have worn crocs for walking hospital corridors and they are fantastic for shock absorbency and these are waterproof as well. Very disappointed that these turned up in the wrong size and not only that, each boot was a different size. One boot was W9 and the other W10 on the sole. The label sewn inside the boots were both W9 and the cardboard tag was W10.
These had been repackaged into recycled cardboard, which is highly commendable, but not very environmentally friendly if you keep having items returned. I am a Prime member and use Amazon Smile for a lot of my purchases, but on this occasion I have returned for refund because of the number of poor reviews regarding wrong sizes being delivered and more than once to some customers. I do not trust that a replacement will be accurately sized. Come on Amazon, sort this out. It's as if someone is just throwing in random sizes in each box to appear to be fulfilling orders.

Not a problem at all the second time around- but dont aske me how--again, the right foot actually gets wet in the slush and snow. pageName: Crocs Women's Classic Neo Puff Luxe Boot Snow
text: These boots are very cool looking, I love the mushroom color. There are 3 things that I like about them and 2 that I don’t. What I like about them: I have wide feet, so this is my priority for any shoes I get, they need to be wide and these boots are just like that; also they have deep sharp grips on the bottom, which is perfect for snow/ice; and they’re lightweight. What I don’t like: they’re pretty stiff compared to the crocs clogs I’m used to, which isn’t necessarily a bad thing, since they’re snow boots. Also they are padded with fur all around on the inside, except the bottom (the sole), where you needed it most, since that’s where the boot has contact with the cold snow, icy pathway, etc., which means the sole of your foot tend to stay cold. I’ll keep them for when I go out shopping or for a walk because they’re too cute and pretty comfortable, but I’m not sure about a day long in the snow, like when you go to a winter resort with snow tubes and want to be out all day.

pageName: DREAM PAIRS Women's Winter Lace up Mid Calf Combat Riding Military Boots
text: I want to start by saying I'm very picky when it comes to my footwear. These boots are decent at the sale price for sure. They are indeed smaller than normal US sizes. I purchased a size 8 with expectation that it would be fitting like a 7.5. They fit more like a seven. When I cut down the insoles I purchased for them I had to cut down to almost a size 7 for them to fit. The toe box is a slight bit tight for my liking however they are rather comfortable other than that. The tread is very thin for a winter boot but nonetheless I have not slipped yet, but it hasn't been icy yet. I would suggest ordering an entire size larger or at least a half size larger than you would normally purchase. They scuff very easily and started looking raggedy quite quick, but take in to consideration I'm very hard on footwear. ?? I'm on my feet 16 hours a day or more sometimes. With good insoles they are comfortable though.

pageName: DREAM PAIRS Women's Ankle Bootie Winter Lace up Mid Calf Military Combat Boots
text:
I really really like these boots! Im on the shorter side so its difficult to find the right height/fit boot especially for this style. I own a few different styles of Dream Pairs shoes and I love them but the sizing seems to be a bit inconsistent. These were 50% off when I got them or I would've switched sizes for sure. Im usually between a 6.5 - 8 (I know lol) but lean towards smaller for other shoes. Last pair of DreamPairs boots I bought were 8 and fit perfectly. I also have 2 pairs of the same style slipper shoes, ones a 7 and ones an 8, and the 8 was definitely a much better fit.SO I went with the 8 for these and they are big. Definitely should've went with the 7.5, maybe even 7. I do wear multiple pairs of socks in the winter so that helps but yeah I'd size down for these. even if it suggests a size,like for me it said to get the 8. I should've listened to my gut lol. overall I really like them and I wear them alot. I like the zipper, the pocket, the style. pageName: DREAM PAIRS Women's Ankle Bootie Winter Lace up Mid Calf Military Combat Boots
text:
I've purchased these boots 4 times over the years. 4 times. They're incredibly comfortable for long stints, true to size, super adorable and don't take forever to break in. My first pair lasted almost 2 years! But after that, I was having to replace them every year or so because the sole detaches and tears beyond repair.

I bought another pair at the end of October, and I had to retire them a week ago. I'm heartbroken. 2 months of moderate - not even daily wear - is crazy for the decline in quality. I love these cheap freakin boots so much that I'm considering paying a professional to fix and replace the soles, but I'm still on the fence over whether or not that's the dumbest idea I've ever had.

Anyway, Pros:
- cute
- one of the most comfortable pairs of boots I've ever worn, ever, period
- fun zipper = great place to stash an extra $20 that you'll forget about and retrieve only when you're really desperate for cab fare, or something

Cons:
- the crappy soles mean that on rainy days, you'll be walking around with wet socks long before you notice the tear in the rubber by the heel
- lures you in with the comfort and style only to fall apart, and I mean literally disintegrate, anywhere from 2 years to 2 months in
- broke my heart. these boots owe me alimony

So in conclusion... these boots were much more solid quality in the past than they are now. They're probably better suited for occasional, very light fashion wear only, despite how deceptively solid they feel once on.
title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
 Favorite boots EVER, adorable and comfortable -- fell apart after 2 (two) months. :(

pageName: DREAM PAIRS Women's Warm Faux Fur Lined Mid-Calf Winter Snow Boots
text:
My last pair of winter boots (which has lasted years and I am very sad that they are wearing out) was from Dream Pairs, so I came back to seek a replacement. I expect these boots will be a great choice if you're looking for functional winter boots with a touch of style and don't mind a little chonk. ;)
Things that make these a good choice of winter boots:
+ Fluffy lining that is comfy and will help keep warm
+ Seem reasonably water resistant (though I did not test this)
+ Sturdy, textured outsole to help minimize slipping
+ Reasonably light-weight
+ Lace and zipper closures -- laces allow you to customize the circumference of the shaft! (The shaft is pretty wide.)
+ There is fabric behind the zipper so unzipping widens the boot opening, but there is a barrier for snow/water between the zipper and you
+ The tongue of the boot is attached to the sides/shaft, again preventing any snow from squeezing in between and giving you cold, sad feet
Things I found less than ideal:
- Because the tongue is sewn to the sides/shaft, if you lace the boots much more narrowly than they are, it makes the stick out in a way that both looks odd and will definitely catch snow instead of keeping it out.
- The laces to not go quite all the way to the top, again leaving room for snow to get in if your ankles/mid-calf require a smaller circumference
- For me, personally, the shaft was quite a bit too wide, and while the laces worked well to fit the boot to my size, it resulted in the above-mentioned issues and resulted in the boots looking really chunky on my in a weird way.
- This last one is NOT an actual issue with the boot (it is very clearly advertised as mid-calf), just something I would really like for winter boots in general: it would be really great if they were knee-high. Where I live, it gets cold enough that wearing multiple layers of fleece, pants, and knee-high socks sometimes just isn't enough, and that tough outer barrier of a boot all the way up to the knees really helps from the biting wind (not to mention to the monster snow dunes).

In the end, I returned these boots because they were to chonky on me, but for anyone with a wider calf or okay with a chonkier look, I think these would be highly valuable, functional winter boots.
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Highly Functional Winter Boot

pageName: Dr. Scholl's Shoes womens Brilliance Wide Calf Riding Boot
text:
I bought these on a whim in November 2022. It’s now March 2024, and I can honestly say these are the best boots I’ve ever owned.

I normally wear anything from 8-9, depending on the shoe, so I ordered an 8.5. It fits great with thin or thick socks. The wide calf probably isn’t as wide as some people would like it, but I have no complaints.

I wear these 3-4 times a week throughout the fall and winter, so they get fairly good wear. The seam where my feet meet my toes to flex upwards have started to crack in the last 6 months or so, but again, I’m wearing them several times a week for 2 years. That’s going to happen.

I have not had any peeling on the heel as some report, aside from what I’d consider normal wear and tear.

All that said, they are starting to look a little worn out and I’ll probably replace them once they’re on sale.
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Review after wearing for 1 year

pageName: Dr. Scholl's Shoes womens Brilliance Wide Calf Riding Boot
text: I wear a 7.5, but I had to get this in an 8 as my feet are short but wide and this shoe has a narrow shape. This worked out well as my foot is snug but not constricted, and the wide calf fits my 17-inch calves perfectly. Not much wiggle room and no stretch in his area, so if you have calves that are 17.5in or larger, I'd pass on this shoe. Find something with garter material. I know if I wear thick, tall boot socks these will be too snug, so stockings or leggings with crew socks will have to do for these. The ankles are a little baggy but that's expected; if you're looking for a clean slim line that makes your legs look long and sleek, this isn't going to be perfect, but it works for me. The heel is the perfect height as it gives my legs a great silhouette without ax excessively high heel. Over all it's exactly what I'm looking for.

pageName: Dr. Scholl's Shoes womens Brilliance Wide Calf Riding Boot
text:
I love the style and fit. But they do run small as other reviews have said.

Another review said they are kinda bulky at the ankles which I also found to be true.

One of my calves is about 18" and the boot *just* fits but is tight and sometimes I have to leave the top inch or so unzipped.

Overall if I wanted another pair of taller boots like these I would go for a flatter sole but that's just my personal sensory preferences.

Comfort I think is subjective. I don't find them to be comfortable for more than 4 or 5 hours of sitting and standing.
But again I usually wear a lower heel and this time I wanted to have cuter boots that look dressier.

I don't know how they hold up to winter temps yet, but I think I'd wear snow boots till I got to work or wherever, then change into these boots. Because Wisconsin life.

A few considerations;
1. These are for narrow feet.

3. For me it was more comfortable with a thin pair of socks. This reduced the chance of rubbing against my toes or the Achilles tendon.
4. IT DOES RUB BEHIND YOUR HEEL. The rub reduces when they are broken in but there is some rub happening perhaps a 1/2 size bigger may help.

text:
I bought these booties about a year ago and have always liked the way they looked and how they were moderately comfortable for having a little heel. However, when I bought them over a year ago they were less than $50. I came to Amazon to purchase another pair and saw they are now listed at $90… they are not worth almost $100. I had these for maybe a few months before the inside of the soles were coming apart, but I didn’t mind because they were decently priced. Now the bottom piece of the heel has completely come apart and because the inside sole didn’t last long, they are so uncomfortable.
For a Dr scholls shoe, these were okay considering the price but now that they are $90 it just isn’t worth it. If you’re looking for comfort and long lasting, spend your money elsewhere.

pageName: Geox Women's D Felicity a Boots
text:
If you have an important calf, this boot is not for you.

The part on the back where you can see the laces has a “fold-down” panel, sewn with the edges facing the outside, and this causes 2 problems:

The panel folded inside takes space away from the calf itself. The
edges extend outwards in an unsightly way and make the leg look even bigger.
The additional problem is that the lace-up loops are sewn not to the boot but to the panel itself, preventing a possible modification of the shoemaker.

In practice, this boot is poorly conceived, it seems to be able to solve a problem that many of us have but in reality this is not the case, it is yet another boot for slender legs.

In addition, the skin is very stiff and is not pleasant to wear. For this price you can find much better
title: It doesn't solve the problem for those with an important calf

pageName: Geox Girl's Jr Agata C Ankle Boots, Black, 7 UK
text:
What can I say about these shoes?
I am extremely disappointed with Geox on this point.
Although they are pretty, they are very uncomfortable.
I don't have wide feet, but I am cramped in this model. They fit me like no pair so far and after a full day of wearing them to work, I come home with blisters and compressed feet.
Here is my full analysis.

Advantages:
+ well-insulated sole even when it is very cold
+ classic style, they can be combined with a lot of outfits

Disadvantages:
- very narrow: they compress my feet and after a day of work, I come home with blisters and my almost blue feet related to cut traffic - the zipper is located on the outside side
- the zipper is located on the outside: they are not easy to close, especially since the closure is at an angle and is easily blocked
- very elongated shoes, strange design Who makes it appear their feet are much longer than they are.

In conclusion: I am disappointed with my purchase, I was counting on timeless and comfortable boots but I realize that the brand favoured the aesthetic side at the expense of comfort. In my case, I don't recommend it.
title: Disappointing

I did not attempt

pageName: Geox Women's Biker Fashion Boot
text:
I state that I am 39 feet tall and I ordered 41 because of another pair of Geox boots ordered and returned number 40 (Geox model similar to this but still different). I had to make them because it was impossible to put them on my feet because, even if the foot slipped in, it was the heel that could not fit into that triangle dedicated to the shoe. I could try to get in shape but with the high risk of splitting the seam at the height of the Achilles tendon. So I preferred to return them and ask for the refund (which I got). I didn't accept the possibility of trying a different number because I already wear 39 and ordered 41 and then I didn't have space to insert the heel (the internal seams of the reinforcing triangle were folding inwards, obstructing even more than a miserable dedicated triangle).

To better understand each other, the heel structure is made like that of many closed shoes that are perfect on the stick of the packaging form. The problem is that that reinforcement does not intend to give way in in the least and the use of a shoe has not helped to enlarge that reinforcement to allow even the heel to descend and not only to the rest of the foot.

I don't know if only that pair were defective and others weren't, but Geox (after two returns in a row and for numbers higher than mine) has disappointed me highly. Over time I have already encountered completely ill-thought out Geox products with internal seams that make it impossible to walk and so even widening didn't mean anything... But in a store it's one thing to try as well, in this case it was a new test that Geox seems to me to have created worse quality shoes with worse details over the years.

I give two stars because the return worked anyway. I can't give more because of the quality that has suffered the most.
title: Taken two extra numbers, the heel does not fit because of the internal reinforcement.

I bought my first pair Geox boots last winter. I wear through shoes easily and was impressed that these lasted a whole winter and still look new. When I needed a second pair of boots for snowy weather with traction, I came back to Geox.

I'm normally a size 6, narrow foot but the 6 was tight. I'm wearing the seven which is comfortable enough but ideal fit would've been a 6.5.

5/5 for comfort though, no breaking in needed at all!

As some reviewers mentioned they can be a bit heavy. I bought these to replace my heavy ones so they're not too clomping for me, worth the price.

pageName: Skechers Women's Pond-Lil Puddles-Mid Quilted Lace Up Duck Boot with Waterproof Outsole Rain, Black/Charcoal, 7 UK
text: Very well made, adorable, 'duck-style' rain boot. I wear a size 9, but because of other's reviews on Amazon that they run small(thank-you!), I ordered a size up. I am so glad I did. The size 10 fits me perfectly, with just enough room for a winter sock. This is a well-made boot. Stylish and worth the dough. *The only reason it's a four star instead of a five star rating is because even though it comes with extra tags saying the boots have memory foam, it is only the thinnest, thinnest layer of memory foam. I have other Skechers that have memory foam, and it is a nice cushiony feel under your foot. This boot has a nice soft furry lining, But you can barely feel the memory foam. I'm just going to buy some inner souls to put in there for a bit of cushion. Other than that they are perfect.
title: Good looking boot BUT MAKE SURE YOU SIZE UP

pageName: Skechers Women's Pond-Lil Puddles-Mid Quilted Lace Up Duck Boot with Waterproof Outsole Rain, Black/Charcoal, 7 UK
text: I usually take an 8 in Skechers. I ordered a 9 and the fit overall is good, but it is a bit snug across the instep (where the rubber and fabric meet) on the top of the foot. I have a high instep, so not entirely unexpected. I need to use the pull tab on the heel to get me foot in. I won't be able to wear thicker socks, but my usual socks will be fine

text: I bought these because I deliver packages in the rain. They are fairly comfortable and are GREAT for the rain. They held up wonderfully against the giant puddles. HOWEVER, they have NO GRIP on the front of the shoe. When I go into a building after the rain, my feet slip all over the place. I delivered to an apartment that had painted stairs, on my way up it was slippery. On my way down, I walked VERY SLOWLY. And even them I slipped down the stairs, luckily I caught myself on the way down and only went down 4 steps. I feel that I'll need to buy extra grip cause I don't even feel safe holding my baby while I wear them.

text:
I am a solid 9.5, so based on the previous reviews, I knew to order up. Besides, if I remember correctly, they didn't offer these booties in half sizes. I'll tell you that the 10 is none too large. If anything, my big toes butt up to the tips of the booties, but I'm hopeful that with a little breaking in, that will subside.

This is most likely a case of "you get what you pay for." I really didn't feel like spending over a C note for LL Bean's version, and fact of the matter is that I will only wear these maybe 2-3 times per year. I love the look of these much more than LL Bean's version and I feel optimistic that they'll hold up well given my light usage. No more soaking wet feet! Yay!

text: Relatively satisfied with these Sperry duck boots. I wore them today on a shopping venture in snow and found them to be non slip and comfy. It wasn't real cold ....mid 30s so can't say how warm these would be in really cold temps ....but the inside plaid flee e seems cozy. These are more of an ankle height which I like and the quality seems good. I will say that the innersoles seem thin and the boot could use an insert to make them a bit more comfy...that is non-issue as I plan to do that...plus, they are a 10, and my actual size of 9.5 would have fit perfectly with reg socks. ( They didn't come in half sizes) I tried a heavy sock in these but my feet felt a bit "overwhelmed? They are a winter boot and not meant to be super comfy like a sneaker, so for the time during the year i am going to wear them, makes them keepers. I found as the day went along I became used to them and they turned out to be a good choice. Super cute with the black rubber foot and quilted gray wool upper with a cute flannel- like gray plaid liner. The price was awesome!

text:
I like these, but I don't love them. The bottom seems very thin. I will be adding extra support with some inserts. I can feel the smallest items clearly through the bottom of the shoe (pebbles on road, pieces of mulch, etc.) ... I understand you would feel this through many shoes, but it is almost like flip-flop thickness.

I bought these for walking my dogs, especially in the rainy winter months. The waterproofing is very good, which is why I bought them. The bottom texture started to already smooth out after 1 30 minute walk (all terrains - mixture of road, gravel, mulch, and grass). Just not as comfortable and durable as I thought they would be for being a Sketchers product. I probably wouldn't buy them again unless there is an improvement in the bottom support, thickness, and durability.

pageName: Skechers Women's Pond-Lil Puddles-Mid Quilted Lace Up Duck Boot with Waterproof Outsole Rain, Black/Charcoal, 7 UK
text:
I was waffling between these and the Sperry’s which had reviews saying how hard they were to get on. Sketchers version was just as cute, cheaper and I know Sketchers to make super comfy shoes. Got them and good news : they are hella cute, easy to get on.
The bad news: I wore them shopping and noticed the balls of my feet were sore.
Backstory: I run in minimal tennis shoes which means they have absolutely no cushioning. NONE. I wore Vibrams for 5 years, so my feet are really accustomed to no cushioning for at least 26.2 miles. What sets these sketchers apart is the heel. Since there’s maybe a half inch wedge heel it pushes your weight to the balls of your feet. So instead of even distribution over your entire foot, you are basically walking on the balls of your feet with just the thinnest piece of plastic between you and the pavement. Also these will not be keeping your feet warm. Since I bought these to walk my dog in the winter, I returned them.
Bonus info: I tried on some Sperry’s at Marshall’s and had no problem getting them on. So I’m going to try before you buy a pair of those and see if they are any better.
title: I ended up retuning

pageName: Skechers ON-THE-GO JOY, Women's Ankle Boots, Black (Black Textile Bbk), 4 UK (37 EU)
text:
I have rheumatoid arthritis which primarily affects my feet, and finding footwear that isn't excruciating is a challenge. I have so many pairs of shoes that seemed comfortable when I first tried them on, but were - to paraphrase the late Matthew Perry as Chandler - 'like a kick in the nuts for my feet' once I'd worn them outside for more than ten minutes. Not so with these. Like walking on air from the get-go (literally, they're featherlight and fabulously bouncy), no blisters or breaking-in nonsense required. Easy on and off (I don't personally need that accessibility, I'm just lazy, but many will find this invaluable), they're also surprisingly not too unstylish as so many comfortable shoes are. Depending on how they're styled they have a geeky normcore look about them, which I love.

But best of all, my poor misshapen feet feel cosseted and warm and I can walk without wanting to saw my feet off at the ankles as the less painful option. I am a Skechers convert and will be throwing away all the Useless Shoes to make room for Skechers immediately.
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Exact opposite of a kick in the nuts for your feet

pageName: Skechers Women's On-The-go Joy Ankle Boots
text:
Most Skechers are available in a wide size and I was a little concerned that these weren't, but with the advertised "roomy" toe box I was willing to give them a chance. I have wide flat feet with arthritis and plantar fasciitis.
The width doesn't bother me, and I could get my foot into them hands free with a bit of wiggling. The ankle isn't tight at all (I'm plus sized so sometimes this is an issue).
The support felt good.
Unfortunately the top seam crushed my foot. I work in a lab and wore them for one day of work.
By noon I had to take them off under my desk-- I wasn't even on my feet today and that stupid top seam was so tight I was in agony. I bought these as a potential alternative to my preferred brand because of price. I also purchased some insoles in case the support wasn't what I needed, but I could never get my foot in these with anything other than the provided insoles because of that seam.
Returning, no questions asked.
title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
 Super uncomfortable!

Fast forward to April 2022. Alright, they are still not the most effective boot in wet conditions. They are , however, my favorite boot this winter. I find them so comfortable, so versatile and so easy to just slip on. My other boots are feeling neglected and jealous.

text: Now that I have worn these for a couple of months I need to change my review. We had a mild January and they were perfect for a dry cold day. February has had more snow, ice, melting ice etc. They never said they were waterproof but you would expect to be able to wear them through melting sidewalk ice. You cannot. The other issue is the effort needed to get them on. I finally started using a long handled shoe horn which is fine leaving home but you can’t have one with you all the time so these are not easy to manage in someone else’s home. I’ve been buying Skechers for years and this is the first time I haven’t been totally happy. I’m disappointed to say the least but won’t give up on Skechers.

pageName: Skechers for Work Women's Workshire Peril Steel Toe Boot
text: I bought these work boots by sketchers on a whim back in 2016 at a shoe store and loved them. Our puppy at the time chewed the edges and the shoelaces off, but I managed to still get use out of them. Fast forward 7 years later, it was time to throw them away and find another pair. I hoped I could find the same style, and thanks to Amazon I found them! The only difference that I can see is my original pair had a slightly narrower, curved toe shape and this new pair has a slightly wider toe area which honestly is better. My original pair was camel color and this pair is brown which I don’t mind. Everything else about them looks and feels exactly the same. One thing I absolutely love about these boots is the memory foam sole. It is so comfortable to wear and I’m so glad that sketchers didn’t change that aspect about them. Overall they are durable and long lasting. I’m normally a size 8.5 and they fit perfectly. Will definitely buy again and hope sketchers never discontinues this style!
title:

 Great work boots

pageName: Skechers for Work Women's Workshire Peril Steel Toe Boot
text:
I bought these boots with the expectation that I would need to buy another pair in about 6 months, since that has been the fate of all of my previous work boots. 2 years later I'm still wearing them and they have minimal wear and tear, mostly just near the back of the heal on the inside and some nicks/scuffs on the steel toe. I'm a landscaper and gardener so I walk a ton and work with a lot of heavy tools and rocks and such, and these boots have kept my feet safe and comfy through all types of weather and terrain. The steel toe is solid and has saved my feet from falling heavy objects many times. My feet are very narrow but the wide/relaxed fit of these boots isn't a problem for me once I've laced them up. The ankle of the boot is super cushioned and supportive so the boots stay snugly on my feet.

My only complaint is the boots have almost no arch support and the top of the boot hits right above my ankle which was uncomfortable when I first got them. To solve both problems I use arch support inserts that also give me a little bit of a lift and they fit perfectly with those.
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Most durable work boots I've tried

text:
I ordered these about 7 months ago and have clearly gotten my use out of them. They’ve saved me from getting crushed quite a few time since then and have stood up to the wood, metal and paint in the shop.

I read a lot of mixed reviews about the comfort and quality but I’ve got no complaints, I wear these boots everyday and I love em. The front scuffed rather quickly, but they’re work boots so who cares. A bunch of people in the reviews claimed the souls are uncomfortable but i disagree, 7 months later they are still quite cushioned and soft when I put them on in the morning.

I always wear mine with wool socks and I didn’t get any blisters or rubbing even when breaking them in. They are very comfortable, affordable and have saved my feet from any workplace accidents. I would definitely buy these again if for some reason I f these ones up.

My husband was going to glue it but said that to make it stay, it would feel like I was walking on rocks. Anyway, long story short,, I threw them away. I'm back to my old pair, as much as I love them, I'm not sure about buying another. Just watch out for that flaw and be smarter than me and return them!

pageName: Clarks Hamble Oak, Women's Brogues
text:
As my feet got wider in recent years, unless I'm purchasing sneakers, I more often than not need to go for a wider option, if available.
To this end, after trying and returning many (MANY..) pairs of boots that each and every one were proving their claims of "extra width" false, I have finally stumbled upon these here smart-looking brogues by Clarks.

The shoes look really smart and fit basically any outfit you might want to assemble for work. They are very easy to put on and extremely comfortable when worn. Tying the laces is a little hard as the laces might be a tad hard to pull tight due to the ladder lacing method used, but that can be easily corrected by relacing them using the normal criss-cross method, if desired.

As for the fitting - I used to be a standard 6, but as I mentioned above, my feet grew a little in both width and - it seems - in length as well. As i measured them (by outlining them on paper) and comparing that with Clarks size charts, I estimated that 6.5 wide should be about right. Sadly, the only sizes available in the vicinity were 6, 6.5, 7, and 6 wide and finally 7 wide. As I was really, really set on NOT returning another pair of boots frustrated at their mismatch, I decided that this time, I'm going to be safe rather than sorry and so went for the 7 wide option.

This has turned out rather well, actually! While the elongated nose is a smidgen too long, admittedly it is also very narrow still. Were I to pick a 6 wide, my toes would have a hard time squeeshing in, no doubt. Therefore, having a little extra room in there doesn't seem that bad in comparison (the distance from my big toe to the inside tip of the nose seems to be around 1 - 1.5cm).

The insides feel extremely gentle, well profiled and comfy. The insole is supportive and very nice to the touch. You can feel these are good quality shoes.

When tied up nice and walking around, the shoes seem to have a little space at the heel as well (very little, just enough so the shoe slips a little up and down with each step, but not nerarly enough to squeeze a finder in there, or be visible really) but that's not really an issue, either.
Now as for the midsection width, it's perfect - the shoe fits very well, ensompassing the foot with no "jiggling about" of the foot (that happens when the shoe is too wide), but still there is just enough space that I could - if I wanted - to put on a little thicker socks instead, for the colder days.

They *do* require a little of breaking in though - or perhaps just getting the back side of your heel accustomed to these? - because after the first day of wearing them I did end up withn a blister where the rim of the shoe touches the tendon area above the heel at the back. That's nothing a good blister plaster won't fix and is nowehere near the level of breaking in boots like Martens etc. Plus, the rim at the back does have a little extra padding as well (see the pics attached).

Finally, I have lower back problems and can't wear heals and these shoes are perfect! The heel is hardly 2 cm tall (just below an inch) and I can't really tell there's any heel at all, when walking. To me that's ideal.

PS also, the price is to die for (25 in promo currently), and I don't think you'd be able to find this quality even for twice that! Shoes highly recommended!
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 The "wide" variety fits my feet perfectly!

pageName: Clarks Women's Un Loop Mocassins
text: Have had these many times before . At £80 off the Clarks site I was looking for a more affordable option. Glad I found a pair here - £30 less. Checked the reviews and was a little worried that someone described these as stiff.... need not have worried. The genuine article was delivered and each shoe was full of card and tissue to keep their shape. I almost missed the card under the tongue to be honest and that would have left them uncomfortable for sure! My only gripe is with the contrast stitch on the shoe. I knew this prior to purchase and chose to go ahead. The stitch is a pale colour in contrast to the black shoe and I'm a polisher! I like these shoes to always look smart and if not careful the black shoe polish discolours the stitching. Small gripe but encourage others who feel the same to buy clear polish . The shoe is super comfy , even from 1st wear. Perfect if you are on your feet all day . Leather composition and decent grip on the sole . When I wear them out I'll buy another pair!
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Comfiest shoes

I really needed flats that didn't feel horrible like others I'd ordered, so I kept these. I got the brown ones. But they scuffed VERY easily and it looks like I got a water spot on one of them. So I rubbed mink oil on them, which darkened the color a bit (which improved the shoes, in my opinion). I tried one area with mink oil and another with brown shoe polish. Be careful with shoe polish on these; it didn't take the polish easily because of the material.
title:

pageName: Clarks Women's, Sara Ballet Flat
text:
Finally a pair of narrow ballet flats that actually fit my foot! I have tried at least half a dozen pairs all from top brands. Even other Clarks. None were narrow enough. I have a true, narrow foot and everything seems to be wider these days.
I am a hairdresser, and these are comfortable enough from the first time I wore them for all day where. No rubbing or heal slipping. Since they are leather, I’m sure they will get even more comfortable as they conform to my foot. The foot bed is sueded, so you do not have to wear pantyhose or footies with them.
The price dropped from $90-$53 so watch for changes in price.
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Perfect NARROW fit! Finally! 9n

pageName: Crocs Women's Kadee Ballet Flat
text: The comfiest shoes I have ever owned. I work on my feet 40-60 hours a week entirely on cement / hard-wood floors and if it wasn't for discovering these shoes I'm sure I'd be feeling all kinds of pain. The entire waitressing staff at my restaurant wears them - not an exaggeration - all 12 girls have a pair. They keep your feet cool in the summer and are well aerated so feet don't get smelly. So easy to keep clean (we all run ours through the dishwasher at work!). I have a really wide foot so the shoes took a good couple of shifts to stretch out, plus some walking around at home in 3 pairs of socks helped, but once they're moulded to your feet they are everything you could want. Light weight, comfy, waterproof. My first pair lasted 3 years working full-time, just bought my second. Worth every penny.
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 A Waitresses' Best Friend!!!

pageName: Crocs Women's Crocs At Work Flat | Women's Flats | Work Shoes for Women
text:
I used to live in these shoes. But, sadly, my most recent pair, bought in 2022-2023, are vastly different than all my other previous pairs.
1.) The rubber is softer and not as sturdy feeling and so it is stickier in a way, so they are not as easy to put on.
2.) The same size I always have gotten are now smaller than the originals. So they do not fit well anymore.
3.) They seem to be a different shape entirely, as if the mold they are being made on in the factory has changed, so they are sort of off-kilter.
Too bad. They used to be amazing! But now they are not amazing at all.
title:
2.0 out of 5 stars
 What happened, Crocs? Size and quality and type of rubber has changed and not for the better.

text: I wear these daily. Work, store, church, they go with alimits every outfit. they have ok support—my knee is bad and it usually gives up before my feet can get too sore in these, but they aren’t so flat my arches hurt from basic walking, nor so narrow my wide feet feel pinched. I bought them to replace a similar but not identical Croc flat I’d had for years that was getting too thin in the sole. Overall the shoes are comfortable, good grip, and no one has called me out for wearing Crocs in my office job. My complaint is, I feel like my feet sweat more in this shoe than my last pair. The vent holes are much smaller than the last pair, which I think contributes. I also feel like this shoe is squeakier than my old shoe, though obviously a shoe needs to break in a bit to be a fair comparison to one that was a few years old.

pageName: Crocs Women's Kadee Ballet Flats
text:
Size confusion - First Too Small and then too Large-LOOSE
I really liked these shoes. I order them in my usual size rather than sizing down as recommended see instruction:
• ~ ~“What Size Should I Buy?: These women's Flats Offer A Relaxed Fit And We Recommend ~~~ Ordering A Size Down To The Next Largest Whole Size.”

I normally wear women’s size 11, ordered size 10 as instructed. They felt great, nice hug to the sides and heel, they held onto my foot while walking and pretend dance, but the toes touched and pushed into the end of the shoe… ouch too short! So, I exchanged them for my usual size 11. Here is where it gets confusing. Now the length is better but still nearly too short but the shoe is now over all much wider making the everything to lose for the nimble feel I enjoyed with the smaller size.

There is NO indication of WIDTH choices on the seller's sight so I would expect ALL the shoes to be medium with as the size 10 probably was or NOT? So my normal size 11 is the right length but now too wide. Disappointed I assumed this is how they are always made so I have been trying to find a way to accommodate with inserts that I will have to glue in place. Then I go here to write a review and there is a series of questions:

Toe box –- tight-loose
Width –- narrower than LABEL – true to width – wider than LABEL
Arch support -- No support – Moderate - High support
How does this product fit? - too small - as expected - Too large

The replacement shoes that I have now, and I am trying to use DO have a W on the sole right in front of the size. They are what I would call size 10 ½ length so tolerable but the whole shoe is too wide. So, more confusion… is there such a thing as medium as I need? Or does the W mean women’s shoe size 11? Now that I know all this when I have time, I will reach out to the seller hoping that they can assist. As of right now I am disappointed and confused.
title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
 Size confusion - First Too Small and then too Large-LOOSE

pageName: DREAM PAIRS Women's Revona Low Wedge Ankle Strap Flats Shoes
text:
TL;DR: The DREAM PAIRS Women's Low Wedge Ankle Strap Casual Flats Shoes in Black Nubuck (Revona) are a perfect blend of comfort, style, and practicality. True to size, comfortable, and surprisingly durable in the rain, these shoes are a versatile wardrobe staple.

I recently purchased the DREAM PAIRS Women's Low Wedge Ankle Strap Casual Flats Shoes in Black Nubuck, specifically the Revona model, and I must say, I'm thoroughly impressed. Comfort, style, and practicality converge seamlessly in this footwear.

First and foremost, comfort is key for me, and these shoes deliver. The low wedge provides just the right amount of elevation without sacrificing stability. I can spend hours on my feet without any discomfort, thanks to the cushioned insole and supportive ankle strap.

One of the things I appreciate most about these shoes is their true-to-size fit. Ordering online can be a gamble when it comes to sizing, but these shoes fit like a dream. No need to worry about awkward returns or exchanges.

Appearance-wise, the Black Nubuck material gives off a sophisticated vibe that pairs well with a variety of outfits. Whether I'm dressing up for a night out or keeping it casual for a day of errands, these shoes effortlessly elevate my look.

What truly surprised me, though, is how well these shoes held up in the rain. I've been caught in unexpected downpours on more than one occasion, and each time, my feet remained dry and comfortable. The water-resistant material is a game-changer, making these shoes a versatile option for unpredictable weather.

In summary, the DREAM PAIRS Women's Low Wedge Ankle Strap Casual Flats Shoes in Black Nubuck (Revona) tick all the boxes for me. They're comfortable, true to size, stylish, and durable enough to withstand the elements. Whether you're running errands or stepping out for a night on the town, these shoes are sure to become a wardrobe staple. Highly recommended!
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Stylish Comfort for Any Occasion

pageName: DREAM PAIRS Women's Revona Low Wedge Ankle Strap Flats Shoes
text: Listen, are the shoes cute? Yes. Are they comfortable? Also yes. Can I put them on with my body not bent like a contortionist? No. The clasp is in two separate pieces: the square to hold the strap in place, and the metal bar that goes through the holes poked into the strap is connected to the elastic piece. (If you know the names of these pieces please let me know lmao). I have to bend in impossible ways to get this thing strapped on. Honestly would not recommend, I don’t think the comfortability of the shoe is worth trying to clasp it for ten minutes while bending in impossible ways.

pageName: Dr. Scholl's Shoes Women's Giorgie Ballet Flat
text:
Well, I’ve had a few Dr. Scholl’s shoes in the past and I am very partial to ballet flats. However, these particular shoes aren’t as Dr. Scholl’s-y as they use to be. They aren’t completely unwearable, but they do have a few issues being new shoes.

I normally wear a 9 in shoes (which I did buy) but these I had to buy the 9W because the 9 fit too narrow. I had bought two pairs of 9s to make sure it was the shoe and not me. Even with these 9W, they sit rather high on the back of your foot. If I wear these too long I will most definitely develop a blister.

It doesn’t both me right when I put them on. I am able to go to a few places before noticing the irritation on the upper part of my heal, and this is after the “breaking them in” stage. I’ve even had to take my right show off to drive because my heal was so irritated. Fortunately a blister had not yet formed.

I have always liked Dr. Scholl’s shoes, but at this time, I wouldn’t recommend Dr. Scholl's Giorgie Slip On Ballet Flat. Maybe given some time the quality will return.

3.0 out of 5 stars
 Dr. Scholl's Shoes Women's Giorgie Slip On Ballet Flat

pageName: Dr. Scholl's Shoes Women's Webster Loafer
text:
Love this shoe! I have purchased 3 times, in 3 different size varieties. I am a Sales and Event Manager in a fine dining, high volume restaurant. The majority of my day is spent in front of my computer but multiple times a week, I’m running through our kitchen or pushing and shoving tables and chairs around to see if a specific setup can work. I’ve been wearing these since 2022. They look classy as hell and I feel like they’re good to my feet, my feet don’t hurt, nor does my bunion or high arches. I am a 8-8.5. Recently my podiatrist told me due to my bunion (thanks high heel from early 2000’s!) I should not be wearing any shoe with a narrow toe box. Here’s my take on the sizes I’ve owned in this specific shoe:
Bought in 2021, size 8 regular: Fit great, a tad snug at first but caused no discomfort. They actually stretched out within a few days. And needed up fitting perfectly and were some comfy, classy ass kickers. This pair was awesome for a year. Was time to replace
Bought in 2022, size 9 regular: Figured the 8 was a tad snug, and the size 9 was on sale about $20 cheaper, and recovering financially from the pandemic and I said yup $20 cheaper let go and pulled the trigger. They were fine, weren’t tight at all like my first pair, but felt sloppy on me/to me like I looked like Ronald McDonald. All good still wore them, still have them as a back up. No doubt of comfort, just really comfortable shoes.
Bought in 2023, size 8 wide: This was/ is a really wide shoe. Weird because I feel like everyone that’s reviewed says not wide enough. It is plenty wide for me. Too wide, enough so that the shoe just fits weird and loose. Won’t return, just another back up. I can wear them but feel like my feet look dumpy.
I just ordered a size 8 regular again today. If they’re a tad tight, I’ll pop on my shoe stretcher as I know these are stretchable.
I wear these 5 days a week, and only need to replace them once a year. Yes, please! They’re comfortable, stylish and can match almost any business casual outfit… I have put these shoes through physical situations and my feet always feel comfortable coming out on top. Wish the sole was a bit more durable, but for the weight ( actually weightlessness) of this shoe and the comfort, I’m more than happy to purchase over and over. The key is to finding the right size and width for you…. They’re my go to ass kickers whether in a suit, dress or slacks!
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Perfect daily shoe for business casual with occasional physical activity

Putting the shoes side by side, the supposedly size 7’s are WAY smaller than a regular size 7. I can’t even get my foot in them. I just want a pair of 7 Wides. Why is my only alternative to get a refund? I’m disappointed because I really wanted these shoes. I’m hesitant to send both pair back because what if the 7.5 wides are as close as I ever would have gotten to a pair that will fit? ??

text: I love the look of the shoes! The patent leather makes them look dressy. I usually wear a 9.5 or 10 and got a 10 in these and it was the right size choice. They were a bit snug in the toe area but I think that will "give" the more I wear them. I primarily bought these for concert performances where I am on my feet for hours at a time. I just came off several performances and am glad I bought these shoes. I inserted my used Brooks athletic insoles on top of the insoles already in the shoes (may have contributed to the snug toes, BTW?) because I wanted and needed more cushion. I have high arches; I'd say these have minimal arch support. But with the extra insoles, these work for me, and I think it's a very handsome shoe, dressy but can also pass for casual.

pageName: Dr. Scholl's Shoes Women's Webster Loafer
text:
I’ve bought two pairs of this shoe style, though the first was (almost new) from a thrift store. I gave them the second shot thinking maybe it was because they had been used. Both times, the back of the shoe were murdering my heel rubbing it. At least the first two weeks were miserable unless I have three bandaids on, until the shoes stretched out a bit.
Once that happens these are the most comfortable and cute pair of non-slip shoes. I get si many compliments on them at work and my feet rarely hurt despite how much I walk/run at work.
However, the sole tears very easily and eventually falls off the shoe entirely. Both times I’ve had the sole tear, making an obnoxious squeaking noise for like a month before the sole eventually just falls off (mid shift unfortunately lol).
Despite the quality I will likely still be buying another pair as I have struggled to find any cute non slip shoes anywhere else.
title:
3.0 out of 5 stars

pageName: Geox Women's D Annytah Moc a Moccasin
text: Very comfortable shoe. Soft on the feet even when you wear it for many hours. I had previously ordered a different model of loafers, always Geox, size 41 (my size) but even though the heel came out of my shoes while I was walking, they were too small for me, this is because the model had a round toe, not suitable for my foot. So with this model to avoid the same problem, I took a larger size, even though this one is not a round toe. Unfortunately, my feet are thin and long and therefore they are a bit loose, but I have added an insole and now they are perfect. I could have taken my usual number, but I was worried based on the reviews that it would fit small, but it also fits me in width, in fact! Had it been a little narrower for me it would have been better, since it's a bit wide for me (in foot width, not in length). I have a narrow foot, but I have flat feet and I haven't had all the problems highlighted by others anyway. And I can assure you that with my problem, I encounter several every time I have to buy a shoe. Which is why most of the time I have to try on a shoe before buying it. The fit of these shoes depends on the type of foot you have, it is subjective, with a foot with a narrow sole and a thin heel, I found them very comfortable so much so that I also had to add a gel heel insole, those are attached to the heel of the shoe, so to speak.

pageName: Geox Women's D Annytah Moc a Moccasin
text:
I started buying Geox shoes in the early 2000s and once I'd got over buying shoes with holes punched into the soles was very pleased with them. I have tricky feet, low arches, wide (but not very wide), deep and a tricky joint on one of my big toes and as I am getting older find shoes that don't irritate my toes absolutely essential. The number of shoes I buy and give away after two or three wears is dispiriting.
I find that loafers are frequently my best choice of shape, as they tend to be wider and not cut so low. Geox stopped selling their traditional loafer a long time ago and although their new shoes are cute I haven't had a good fit for a while. I saw these and thought I should give them a try, especially as they were on offer and it makes giving them away if they hurt slightly less painful on the wallet.
So far, three wears, two with stockings, one with just my feet, not bad at all. In a spirit of optimism, I have given them 5 stars both for not hurting my feet from day one and being a great offer.

pageName: Geox Women's D Charlene B Ballet Flat
text:
I bought these shoes to take to the office.
One shredded my ankle and both blistered my little finger because someone thought of putting synthetic material right where they rub against the inside.
They're too narrow and they should say it. They are narrower than other brands in the same size.
“It's leather, it always ends up giving itself.”
Well, no!
And I didn't walk much either, huh? No more than three blocks with them to do all that damage.
It is my usual size, I checked the length of my feet in centimeters and the size chart before buying them.
Interestingly, this has not happened to me even with the heels (even high ones) that I bought in other physical stores or in another app from China, not even with those made of synthetic materials.
The solution? Bandages and pads of tape and tape and go buy some sneakers from (German Sports Brand) and that's it.
I will never buy this brand again.
title: Not suitable if your feet are not too thin.

pageName: Skechers Women's Go Walk Lite-15430 Boat Shoe
text: This is the third pair I have bought in recent years and as comfort is high on my list, I have tended to stay with what I know. I walk every day and find these shoes more comfortable than trainers. They have padded insoles and are machine washable - at least my others are as I have not worn the new ones as yet. I would rather they were leather (or synthetic leather) instead of canvas, but the canvas is very strong. Two pairs of laces are included. My only negative point is the variation in price which seems to change depending on size and colour, not by just a few pounds either. However, I guess it's up to the buyer to purchase at an acceptable price - it just seems questionable why the variation is so great.

text:
I ordered these on Prime try before you buy, and as soon as they arrived, I put them on, and instantly loved them. These shoes are incredibly lightweight and well made. I particularly like the anchor detail on the back of the shoes as I was in the WRNS many moons ago.
I’m a standard size 5 shoe, and they fit perfectly. They come with a pair of white laces as well as the brown, but I prefer the brown pair.
I originally ordered them to wear when walking my dog, but as soon as I saw them, I decided they were too good for that. They are great to wear with absolutely anything, jeans, shorts, skirt, I’m pleased that I bought them, and on top of all that, they are washable. What’s not to like?

pageName: Skechers Women's Cleo Bewitch Closed Toe Ballet Flats
text:
So, let me preface this by saying, of you looked closely at the picture you will see I am wearing these shoes and I have put 5 little stars on the picture with an arrow pointing at the shoes. Why, you ask? Well, read on....

I have been one of the "lucky" folks in this world to develop something called Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS), following a surgery on my left foot/Ankle. If you know about this horrible syndrome you would know that to put anything on my foot causes me extreme pain (I gave birth completely naturally many years ago and that was a cake walk compared to this). I was preparing to travel to Korea to attend one of my daughter's weddings and did not want to go in only a socked and slippers foot so I searched and searched to see if I could find at least a casually dressy shoe to wear. I literally had about 20 different shoes sent to my house on the try before you buy thing and....well, I cried when I was able to put these on and tolerate them. It was not pain free, but not even a sock is for me. But, it was dressier than a sock.

That picture is me, in South Korea, wearing these shoes. This was taken after I climbed a ton of stairs (very carefully and at a snails pace), but I did it! And I couldn't have done it in any other footwear that I own!

So, absolutely recommend if you have wide feet, pain in your feet, and you want to try and dress things up a little sometimes. I wore them for several hours. For me that is a win.
title: Read My Review for Details

pageName: Skechers Women's Cleo Bewitch Closed Toe Ballet Flats
text: Best flats I’ve ever had, so I bought 2! As far as flats go, these are the comfiest you’ll find. And no odd smell :)
title: If you have to go flat, these are the best!

text:
Fits well , no arch support in these ones but do have a memory foam insole . Good for work . Stretch out when you put your foot in , no rub spots so far .
* on side note I did not expect these delivered to my house , as we have major road construction that was supposed to be done yesterday and unfortunately was not . So thought I would have to go to a pick up location. Which is totally fine , because our road is demolished. To my surprise my Amazon driver walked through the mess of construction on our street ( we can’t even drive into our driveways right now and it had been torrential downpours today, so it’s a muddy mess on top of the construction mess ) and he dropped it right on my doorstep . I have had other competitors company drivers when there is not even any construction and they can not even make to my door “because of delays” or dropping two street over at the wrong house -twice - and this driver made it all through this mess ! I wish I could show you , you can barely walk to your front door on my street right now . Thank you to all Amazon drivers who go well beyond what is required!!!

pageName: Skechers Women's Cleo Bewitch Closed Toe Ballet Flats
text:
The shoes are incredibly comfortable because of the memory foam and the very supple material that the shoe is made of. The sole is also very flexible, so overall very comfortable.
I've tried on a few ballerinas recently, most are not as comfortable at the outset, sometimes even painful.

I can't report anything about the shelf life yet. But since the shoes can also be washed in the washing machine, I assume that they are among the more robust shoes.

The design is very classic and never goes out of style.

Finding the right size is a bit difficult.
On the one hand, the shoes are tapered and Skechers also tend to be a bit smaller. However, ballerinas should never be too big, otherwise they are unwearable. So my recommendation is to choose half a size larger for now. If you fluctuate between 2 sizes, choose the larger ones.
For me, the length of the shoe was too tight so that my toes looked over the sole.
Width was ok, my feet are a bit wide.
title: By far the most comfortable ballerinas

pageName: Skechers Women's Skechers Women's Cleo Bewitch Ballet Flat
text:
So, let me preface this by saying, of you looked closely at the picture you will see I am wearing these shoes and I have put 5 little stars on the picture with an arrow pointing at the shoes. Why, you ask? Well, read on....

I have been one of the "lucky" folks in this world to develop something called Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS), following a surgery on my left foot/Ankle. If you know about this horrible syndrome you would know that to put anything on my foot causes me extreme pain (I gave birth completely naturally many years ago and that was a cake walk compared to this). I was preparing to travel to Korea to attend one of my daughter's weddings and did not want to go in only a socked and slippers foot so I searched and searched to see if I could find at least a casually dressy shoe to wear. I literally had about 20 different shoes sent to my house on the try before you buy thing and....well, I cried when I was able to put these on and tolerate them. It was not pain free, but not even a sock is for me. But, it was dressier than a sock.

That picture is me, in South Korea, wearing these shoes. This was taken after I climbed a ton of stairs (very carefully and at a snails pace), but I did it! And I couldn't have done it in any other footwear that I own!

So, absolutely recommend if you have wide feet, pain in your feet, and you want to try and dress things up a little sometimes. I wore them for several hours. For me that is a win.
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Read My Review for Details

pageName: Clarks Women's Brinkley Sea Flip Flops
text:
I started purchasing this brand and style of sandal over 6 years ago to use as a slipper around the house. The comfort was what I needed since I spend a lot of time on my feet baking and cooking, grooming our dogs, and other household chores. These sandals are so comfortable, cushion my feet and reduce the shock impact on my knees.
One pair would last me 6 months or more, depending on how quickly the tread would wear out. I reiterate...they were only worn in the house.

In the last 18 months, the trend is for the sandals to break down. The quality is not there. It happens in the same place every single time. The heel area starts to pull away from the sides, then it collapses down, so the heel is not cushioned and is actually sunken. This last pair, bought in 05 NOV 2023, only one shoe has done this so far, but this time for good measure it actually cracked on the outer side of the sandal at the back.
In the last 12 months I've purchased 4 pair and every single pair has done this, one pair in 3 month's time.
It is so disappointing. I've tried other sandals but nothing comes close to the comfort and the cushioning support. I find actual slippers not supportive enough, or too hot, to these sandals were ideal - even if the podiatrist disagreed due to no strap around the heel of the foot to hold the shoe on. I told her the comfort was the key.

I truly wish Clarks would go back to the original way of manufacturing, or materials, or whatever it was that made the sandals last. Since the breakdown is identical every single time, there has to be some manufacturing issue.
So for comfort fit and lightweight - high marks. However, value - too expensive for such a short period of use. Looks as if I will have to find another shoe to use.
title:
2.0 out of 5 stars
 Not What They Were

text:
I bought these as a gift, but I already have owned two pairs of these myself and made another ones to my mum as a gift too.
These sandals have a more informal look than others, but still look cool.
They are very very comfortable to walk on them and I bought them specifically first time because the materials don't include plastic or artificial colours which cause contact allergic reactions on my skin. The stripes are made of leather and fabric, which is a very important point for me. Comfy and safe, what else can I ask for?
Also, the stripe has a velcro which allows it to be narrower or wider depending on the width of your feet.
Very happy with them and they are in multiple colours too.

pageName: Clarks Women's Merliah Karli Sandal
text: I have been wearing Clark's shoes for many years and prefer them over all other brands. The last used to create all Clark's shoes seem to be made for my feet. I have flat feet and plantar fasciitis and the contour of the footbed supports my arch and prevents the pain that can come with my condition. They fit great from the first time I tried them on and there is never an uncomfortable period time at the beginning of "breaking in" new shoes. I looked a long time to find a pair of white sandals that weren't backless, but never found it. However, these backless sandals have velcro adjustable straps so as the leather stretches with wear, they will always fit and not get too loose. The leather is very nice and the design on the straps makes for a very interesting texture.
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Clark's makes a good shoe!

text:

In that black, the 6 had loose straps, so my toes slid forward over the edge, but 5 are subtly small in length. The bone, however, was different. The 6 was a perfect fit.

Now, I wear these constantly. I have very tender feet, and fibromyalgia, which exacerbates pain and sensitivity, making walking in most shoes rather a short exercise. Not with these, however. They don't need wearing in, they don't stretch at all so they've stayed true and strong, even when worn daily in a job that requires many steps. To top it off, they look so nice. I really don't like the clogs, and the flip flops are oddly big and clumsy with nobbles underfoot, but the Brooklyn style sandals look lovely, both with casual and with pretty or formal clothes.

The support for the feet is good, and it's like walking on springy memory foam. The wedge gives me height but they're pliable enough for me to drive in them.

I now need to save up to collect all the colours.
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 It's official. Crocs are my favourite sandals.

pageName: Crocs Women's Literide 360 Sandal W Clog
text: I bought these to take to Bali with me for a few weeks as I knew I'd be walking a lot in the heat and wanted good sturdy shoes that also complimented my outfits. I found them!!! These are lightweight so didn't take much room in my suitcase, really cute in appearance and they did not cause one blister or mark on my feet like others have. They lasted all day in all types of terrain, the grips are great, the comfort levels are insane. I was worried about the straps at the back as some reviews mentioned they snapped but I had no issues. Highly recommend these to anyone going away and know they will be walking a lot. Already buying some for my mum and sister for Christmas!
title:

pageName: Crocs Women's Literide 360 Sandal W Clog
text:
Brought for an 18 day trip to Egypt and Jordan.
The sole to these are both pillow soft for your foot and sturdy on the sole for durability. So comfortable! I have slightly wide feet but the ban across the toes is well sized and has a small amount of give, the top band is plenty long enough and adjustable.
I am usually a perfect size 5 in all shoes but these run a tiny bit small and only just fit length wise. If there was a half size option this would be perfect but the 6 would certainly be too big so I will make do!
This is my second pair of shoes from Croce's (also have the Brooklyn Wedges) and I can't recommend enough!

pageName: Crocs Women's Literide 360 Sandal W Clog
text: I'm a Florida girly. My choice in footwear is sandals all day. But I spend most weekends at the Orlando City games. Between walking around downtown and standing for 90+ minute games, my slides, sandals, all those were causing major foot pain. They weren't appropriate or comfy for this purpose but there was no way I was going to start wearing sock and sneakers to outside games in 90+ degree weather. I immediately looked to crocs for a solution that would be open and airy, but comfortable and supportive for long periods on my feet. These are the perfect solution. I've done up to 10k steps a day in these with zero pain. They do exactly what I needed without compromising on heat and comfort. They fit great, I'm usually in an 8/8.5. I got these in a 9 (i think they were out of 8s at the time) and while they're slightly big, it causes no trouble. You can tighten the middle strap so i certainly don't notice the little extra room. Not enough to seek any other pair of shoes right now. I'm wearing these til they fall apart.
title: OBSESSED! Exactly what I wanted

pageName: Crocs Women's Literide 360 Sandal W Clog
text:
I've been using other types with crocs heel bands for over 2 years for the office
.
It has a fastener like a belt, but it stretches with rubber and was easy to wear, but the rubber stretched too much and broke, I couldn't wear it if I was a supporter due to a sprain, and the heel band was so stiff that it
hurt when I stepped on it, so I was looking for it.

If you're a supporter, you can't wear it with the heel band fastened, but there's no sense of incongruity when stepping on it, and since it's silicone, you won't get used to it, and the sole is gentle on feet that hurt due to fuzzy, velcro, so if you make it the biggest, you can wear it without removing it every time, and I wish I had bought it sooner!




List price depending on color and size? It's expensive, but
it's just the size and color I want, and it's great because it's not too big.

pageName: Crocs Women’s Brooklyn Low Wedges, Platform Sandals
text: These sandals were great for a trip to Hawaii. The brown color I got was the perfect neutral color for outfits. I sized down from a 7.5 to a 7 and the fit was just right. They work well with shorts or skirts and dresses. I wore them some on the beaches, and they were great to transition from damp or wet pool areas to dry areas. They are extremely light and comfortable to wear and look sleek as wedges. I don't have anything else by this brand, and other people were surprised that they were crocs. I received lots of compliments while wearing them. After the third day of heavy walking, I did get a few minor blisters- there is more friction under the strap if they get damp or wet, so you might want to bring some patches for that.
