pageName: DREAM PAIRS Women's Hi-Lo High Heel Platform Pump Sandals
text:
Beautiful shoe nice quality pretty fabric nice fit.
I bought these in silver with the strap that runs around the top of the foot.
For me the silver shoe didn't need breaking in.
I also bought the floral fabric ones.
The floral pattern will need a little breaking in.
They are much tighter over the top of the toes (width).
I suspect these are a (B) width, those with wider feet and long toes might not be as happy with the fit of this shoe style.
Both shoe styles are high almost a stiletto height so if you wear stiletto’s this style of shoe should be comfortable.
The chunky heel is thick at the heel then tapers down so its a slimming look to the leg.
Also, the thicker heel and platform helps give more stability making this shoe super comfortable and easy to walk in.
I would buy these again because the fit is nice the shoe is stylish and super cute on and gives a wow factor to any outfit.
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Trendy High Platform with Thick Tapered Heel

text:
Pros: Gold-color is true to photo. Appearance of shoe true to photo.
Size is relatively accurate, but the straps were a bit loose for me; could have used more holes.

Cons: The wedge has a very narrow base; on the bottom it slims down from the arch to the heel so the shoe is not as wide as you'd think. This is okay on a relatively hard surface, but not super stable on medium plush carpet. I returned it for this reason.

pageName: DREAM PAIRS Women's Two Strap Open Toe Low Block Chunky Heels Sandals Dress Pumps Shoes
text: Before my purchase, I read the reviews and was skeptical about the straps fitting my feet. I wanted to feel safe and secure in these cute sandals! They delivered on time and are well made. When I first put them on, the lower strap fit perfectly across my toes-no problem! The upper strap was not as good…until…I put the strap where I wanted it on my foot. I simply raised it by pulling the strap up towards my ankle a smidge more. Once I got it in place, I moved around the kitchen emptying the dishwasher, giving these shoes a quick test with plenty of movement. They are wonderful! They feel comfortable and my feet feel secure. I sat for a few minutes and upon getting up, the straps were still in place! I think I need to continue wearing them until the upper strap “remembers” where it should be on my foot! I would buy again in black, these may be my go-to summer sandal! If you buy and are unhappy, adjust the strap a bit until you are satisfied. Then, be patient as it molds to your foot. Enjoy!
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Adjust the straps to your feet!

text:
First off these shoes are actually cute for being Dr Scholls even the lady at UPS commented when I returned them. But a lot of sandals are cute that don’t provide arthritic, joint pain, orthopedic aide and comfort. That was the entire reason for buying these and they feel extremely short.

All I had to do was put them on in my house for 2 minutes and I knew right away I could not wear them with my bad knees. But isn’t that the entire point of these shoes by Dr Scholls????

I do not recommend unless you just randomly like these for their look and don’t need pain assistance

They are also raised which give it an unsupportive feeling. Overall the sole is not soft or set up for shock absorption.

To me this shoe is misrepresented entirely for what it is

pageName: Dr. Scholl's Shoes Women's Barton Wedge Platform Sandal
text:
I rarely write product reviews, and I am not one of the 10k people that start every review like this. I really wanted to tell you my experience with these shoes.It started with late night shopping about 8 YEARS AGO. I bought a black pair of these shoes from QVC and remember paying over 80.00 for them. Late night shopping, wine and a credit card do not usually turn out so well, but in this case- I got lucky and stuck gold!!
I have worn these on so many vacations, long walking days, and many nights out!
(I am a nurse- so I can't wear at work unfortunately)
When I realized my black pair were wearing out (still wearable!) I started thinking how nice it would be if I could find the same pair still available... in shoe time 8 years is pretty long to find the same shoe!
So being a long shot...
I typed in "Dr Scholls Wedge snake skin sandals" to the Amazon search and found them!! Now, a lot of things make a women happy, but finding the "perfect shoe" available in 5 colors and your size for 35.00-50.00... !!?? That is like an amazing night on the town with good food, wine, friends and dancing <thats is, let's not go overboard they are just shoes- haha>.
I typically wear 7 or 7.5
sandal/heels or 7.5 to 8 in boots/sneakers. My feet are pretty narrow, so I would order "wide" if have wider feet or are in doubt.
Overall, they run pretty true to size. I ordered a 7.5 and it was a little big so then tried a 7. Honestly, either would have been fine. However I kept the size 7, because I remembered that the straps slightly stretch over time. So if in doubt go i would try the smaller size.
The size/information on the shoe itself is tricky to find- so here is the where it is found... it is on the inside/ under of the strap, up near the the pinky toe.

By the way- I now have 2 pairs of black, 2 pairs of brown, 1 of the beige, and the blue Jean - which I wasn't sure about...but OMG they look amazing and adorable with jeans/ Jean skirt and I have a blue Jean short outfit...so cute!

Hope this helps and if Dr Scholls is reading- I am available for interviews, comments and commercials at my convenience.
(Just kidding of course, I will make myself available to you anytime.)
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Most amazing shoe ever!!

pageName: Dr. Scholl's Shoes Women's Islander Strappy Flat Sandal
text:
I LOVE THESE!

Comfort - What I consider to be the most important thing, these are one of the most comfortable sandals I have ever had! The straps aren't too tight, and if so, they're so stretchy I don't think they would be uncomfortable. The bottom (where your foot rests) is soft but supportive. I have walked miles in these as though they were tennis shoes just because I could! Chasing after a toddler never posed to be an issue either. The top of the sandal is also roomy, and large enough to allow your feet to move as they were designed to. Nothing ever felt squished.

Design - They're just cute! I feel like this is an "in" style and maybe I'm out of the loop or just in my mom era, but I also just loved how they looked on and off of me. It's important! We like stylish yet comfort!

The only downfall to this shoe is that the beige on top of the sandal has occasionally gotten something on it and because of the color it stands out like a sore thumb. Things fall on shoes, they get dirty. I truthfully have not tried to scrub it out yet. BUT if your shoes stay clean forever, kuddos to you and you will love this sandal!
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Love them!

pageName: Dr. Scholl's Shoes Women's Islander Strappy Flat Sandal
text:
I bought these for a two week trip to Italy. I ended up doing almost 20k steps a day for the whole trip while wearing these shoes. No blisters. No chafing. And I didn’t even break them in before the trip!

They were amazing! Sadly, they are absolutely wrecked after only that two week trip (due mostly to the rough terrain that I was on and the staining from salt water) but I think I will repurchase for more casual wear. I liked that they aren’t just a flat shoe and have some support, plus the elastic makes them easy to put on/off and light to carry.

EDIT: I dropped my rating from 5 to 2 stars. I ended up getting a second pair - same story of no break in period (beyond about two weeks of squeaking) and no discomfort. However, this pair also started to fall apart within about 4 weeks of standard wear. The sides flopped off and won’t stay with glue, and the bottom is disconnecting. SO SAD because of them being so comfortable. Overall very disappointed since shoes shouldn’t only last a month with regular wear.
title:
2.0 out of 5 stars

These are super cute and can be dressed up in a summer dress or down in shorts. I get tons of compliments on them. They are true to size and provide excellent support for my archy feet. pageName: Dr. Scholl's Shoes Women's Islander Strappy Flat Sandal
text: I was so excited to get these as I’ve had good experiences with Dr. Scholls sandals in the past. Upon first try on they were a good fit and comfortable (comfortable straps, low height with some support, not too flat), but once walking around they started giving me really painful burning/rubbing sensation under the ball of my foot, eventually leasing to blisters. I always expect some wear in period and blisters from sandals at the start of a new pair and even each new summer season getting my feet back into sandal season, especially with the amount of walking we do in nyc, but these are sadly unbearable. I’ve never had such a strong painful burning feeling on the ball of my foot or from a regular blister. It’s like the material of the inner sole is just causing too much heat and friction with every step. Very painful. I kept trying them again seeing if they needed to break in, but no luck and even used blister / corn protector pads, but the friction rips them off my feet. I have to now just get rid of them after only a couple months.

text: I ordered a size ten. I was not able to get them on my feet. I looked at the label in the shoe to make sure it was the right size, and the UK and EU sizes were also listed. The UK was listed as a size 7, which is a US size 9, and the EU was listed as a size 40, which is a US size 9. The US size was listed on the label as a size 10, but if the other two sizes listed are correct, the US size is wrong, and these are actually a size 9 which have been labeled incorrectly. There was no way they were ever going to fit.

pageName: Geox D Sandal Vega D, Women’s Closed Toe Sandals
text:
Probably the most uncomfortable pair of sandals I have owned in 27 years.
They look cool, but they will destroy your feet. I'm a size 5.5 normal fitting. I brought a size 5 after reading every review stating they come very large: they definitely do not. As you can see from the pictures I have normal feet, I am slim and do not have any condition or issue or bunion or anything like that. Well let me tell you: these sandals will murder your feet. The stitching on the footbed is very stiff and raised, with the effect of being constantly rubbing on your feet in the most sensitive places. The leather straps across the foot are very constrictive and stop the blood flow of your little toe. They are also incredibly narrow.
A real shame because they are seriously expensive, and from Geox I would expect a much better product. Now it's also too late to return them because you only notice how terrible they are after wearing them a few hours :(
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
 They will murder your feet. Very very narrow fitting

This is my first pair of this brand and they fit me well, the length is perfect, they are not too tight which leaves a small margin of comfort in very hot weather when the feet swell
I am very happy because I always have difficulty finding sandals that fit me, the 37 often too tight and the 38 too wide... because I have a fairly thin
foot In addition they are beautiful in cognac and I was able to “trot” for more than an hour without problem

pageName: Geox Women's W Sandal Vega 11 Dress
text: I ordered a size ten. I was not able to get them on my feet. I looked at the label in the shoe to make sure it was the right size, and the UK and EU sizes were also listed. The UK was listed as a size 7, which is a US size 9, and the EU was listed as a size 40, which is a US size 9. The US size was listed on the label as a size 10, but if the other two sizes listed are correct, the US size is wrong, and these are actually a size 9 which have been labeled incorrectly. There was no way they were ever going to fit.
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars

pageName: Skechers Women's D'lux Walker New Block Sport Sandal
text:
I would love this sandal, but unfortunately I had to send it back. Unfortunately, the Velcro strap on the shoe is too short for my wide instep (annoying water retention in summer). The two Velcro clips overlapped just under 1 cm. Certainly not enough for a good grip in the long run.
Otherwise, a great shoe that women with a narrower instep will surely love!! Don't worry, the sole looks high, I don't even walk on higher shoes and otherwise bend over immediately. But there was really no problem here. It provides fantastic shock absorption, so you don't have to walk unsteady!
When developing, please apply longer Velcro, then I will get it again immediately!!

text: I found the sole to be the correct size, but the elastic was very tight but not terribly uncomfortable. September 3rd). The next morning, I had a very sharp pain in my arch. After two weeks of the pain growing worse, I went to a podiatrist to learn I have plantar fasciitis! I continue to have lots of pain, and am in Physical Therapy (five weeks from onset. text: I absolutely love Sketchers because I have short and wide hobbit feet, So I thought these would be a perfect solution for when I go on vacation to hike. Unfortunately, these just missed the mark. They were great for walking around on a flat paved surface for two or three miles, but when I took them to do an actual hike on uneven ground going vertical, I got severe foot pain from them. So, if you're looking for a casual sandal that is waterproof and super cute, these are fabulous. But I would not take them hiking. I ended up switching to my regular Skechers and those were much better for hiking. Just a bummer because then they got soaking wet and didn't dry as quick.

text:
I was pleasantly surprised at how comfortable these sandals are. I rarely wear anything but flip flops on my feet, because straps and buckles usually irritate me. And if I have to sit down and use two hands to put on shoes, I just won't wear them. So, pretty darn finicky. And these sandals are keepers for me.
I did take one star off because the arch support for the outer foot is a little high. It won't stop me from wearing them, but I can feel it. I guess it's preventing your rolling your weight onto the outer part of your foot, if you need that.
Straps, buckles, all are hardly noticeable when walking. No blisters or sore feet. I'm very happy with these sandals!

text:
These are very attractive, colorful and cute sandals. There is a deep cushion underfoot. The straps that cross over the instep are somewhat adjustable, if and when one's feet swell at the end of a hot day with lots of walking. The straps are multicolored without a definite pattern, so they can be worn with clothes of any color combination and print.
Cute, comfy, and I would buy them again in the unlikely event I lose them, because they are also sturdy and I expect to wear them for many years!

pageName: Clarks Women's Nalle Lace Sneaker
text:
Bought these as I have the black ones with white soles which are amazingly comfortable, but these having black soles were less obvious trainers so thought would be a smarter comfort option when needed. That wasn’t the only difference!! These are NOT the same just different coloured soles at all!! Even though they are the same make & style name & ‘spec’ they are totally different to the ones you buy in their shops. The leather is so unbelievably hard! The ones I bought in the shop are like wearing slippers & walking on air! These are like walking in plastic caked in concrete! I’ve never had so many blisters! I stupidly wore them so can’t return them but they are going in the bin! They are definitely Clark’s but very inferior stock being sold with the Clark badge to con us. So I’m never going to buy anything from Clark’s again!really disappointed, angry & my feet hurt!
DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
 Dreadful - not same quality as the ‘same’ones sold in their shops

pageName: Clarks Women's Breeze Ave Sneaker
text: I absolutely love the Clark’s brand! All of my Sandler are made by them so I was excited to try the tennis shoes. I’m not thrilled. They aren’t good and they aren’t bad. They’re just ok. Like any off brand shoe. The Sandler are all I can wear in the summer. I can’t walk for hours in any other shoes. These are just meh.. low sides and quite snug like a narrow but I’m sure they will stretch out some. Like I said. Meh…
title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
 Not what I’m use to from Clark’s

pageName: Clarks Women's Breeze Ave Sneaker
text: I am keeping these shoes because I paid for them and the price is right, but I am not as happy with them as I thought I would be. The shoes are made of material that is more durable than comfortable. It will give a little but not much. I figured out that I can wear them best without socks. Maybe that’s my fault? Maybe post Covid my feet got used to not being in closed toe shoes? Perhaps I should have gotten a larger size? They look ok. It’s nice not having to lace them up. But, I guess, I thought that with this brand they would be really, really comfortable.
title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
 Ok. Not very comfortable.

pageName: Clarks Women's Breeze Ave Sneaker
text: I ordered up a half size, so maybe that was part of the problem, although initially when trying on they seemed fine. I've worn them only twice, and both times after 5 minutes my heels were raw and bleeding. It's the way the heel is shaped and cuts in at the top. I got so angry at the shoes I cut the backs down. They were all bloody anyway, but I don't know yet if that will help. I have to wait a couple weeks until my heels heal.
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars

text:
In 2019, I bought CLARKS boots on Amazon for a trip to NYC, I had them arrive at the place where I was going to stay. That's how risky my purchase was. And that time was exceptional, the most comfortable boots of my life and I walked 20,000 steps a day for 5 days in NYC and loved CLARKS.
With that excellent experience, I bought these CLARKS white shoes in the same size as my boots, but they are very tight, the bottom is very narrow and they are not comfortable at all. I haven't been able to release them. My foot is thin; that is, I am not a W wide foot. It's a shame because the shoes are beautiful. The return date has also passed. I'll look for someone who can enjoy them.

pageName: Clarks Women's Breeze Ave Sneaker
text: I love this shoe. After foot surgery - over 20 years ago - it is still hard to find shoes that are comfortable. I really dislike shoe shopping for this reason. Of course one has to pay a penalty for the poor surgery - and thus I'm always looking for well made, COMFORTABLE, affordable, attractive shoes - Clarks Breeze fits the bill. The only point I might make is that I've owned the shoe for 1 yr. and the heel is wearing down. That is most likely because I wear it all the time. It's not a winter shoe/sneaker - it's lightweight - although there's no rule that says you can't wear it with socks. However, I wore it w/o socks last summer, into fall and again in spring. I've ordered 2 more pairs. I got each on sale $59.00, $55.00 and $39.00 - the original price is about $70.00. I would readily pay $70.00 for this COMFORTABLE and well made shoe/sneaker. Enjoy. peace
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars

pageName: Clarks Women's Breeze Ave Sneaker
text: This is,for me, a trusted brand. I currently own 6 other pairs of Clarks shoes, all sort of the same style: higher heels in black (except for the red pair!). The chunky heels are all very comfortable, so I thought the sneaker style would be amazing. Unfortunately, although they look great,these are not comfortable for me. They feel too snug and they are very hot. In short, I don't like this style, but will continue to shop the brand if the need arises. At 72, it's entirely possible that I won't ever have to buy another pair of shoes. However, if absolutely necessary, I would start with Clarks.

text: I am not one to leave long comments or reviews but in this case I feel committed to doing so. I bought these shoes because I really like this brand and they are also very pretty; it was a very good offer. I have a problem that my size is small and it is difficult for me to find beautiful and also cheap shoes. I ordered a size 5 but received a 6.5. They really are very beautiful and comfortable but there is no way to keep them because they are excessively large. However, I contacted the seller and raised my case and immediately received a response from the customer service team who were extremely kind and cared about trying to find a solution for me. Unfortunately they did not have my size in their inventory and that is why the change was not possible, but they offered me a refund of the amount paid and that I could still keep the product in case I wanted to donate it to someone else. I have had some experiences with purchases that have not been what was expected, but beyond the incident itself, what matters is THE QUALITY OF CUSTOMER SERVICE that they provide and how they make you feel taken into account, respected and valued. I will definitely buy from this seller again.

pageName: Clarks Women's Adella Holly Sneaker
text: I kept reading and hearing great things about Clark shoes, so was quite optimistic about getting these. Both my knees are arthritic due to ACL surgeries, and a few years ago I had a bout of plantar fasciitis so am careful about what shoes I wear. I got these specifically for an event that was going to have me on my feet a lot for a week. I noticed the first day I wore these that they forced my knees into an unnatural position but I thought maybe it was just a matter of getting used to them. By the second day my knees were much more painful than usual, I thought maybe because I was on a concrete floor all day. By the third day the pain was excruciating. Unsure if the pain was due to the variables listed above, I wore them to work when I got home and within a few hours felt the same pain. Tried them one more day but brought a spare pair of shoes to change into just in case, and I had to make the switch after less than an hour. I can’t figure out exactly what it is about rhe design of this shoe that changes my gait and causes such pain but I do know that I will never wear them again!

pageName: Crocs Women's Literide 360 Pacer W Clog, Almost White Almost White, 6 UK
text:
As an ICU registered nurse, my days are long, demanding, and unpredictable. Finding footwear that can keep up with the pace while providing comfort and support throughout my shifts has always been a challenge. That is until I discovered the Crocs Women's LiteRide 360 Pacer.

Comfort and Support: These shoes are a game changer in terms of comfort. The LiteRide foam footbeds are incredibly soft, offering a cushioned ride that feels like walking on clouds, even after 12+ hours on my feet. Their support is unparalleled, ensuring that foot fatigue and soreness are a thing of the past.

Durability and Cleanliness: Working in the ICU means I encounter all sorts of spills and splashes. The LiteRide 360 Pacers' material is not only durable but also easy to clean, which is essential for maintaining hygiene in a healthcare setting. A quick wipe-down is all it takes to keep them looking fresh and ready for another shift.

Slip Resistance and Safety: The traction on these shoes is fantastic, giving me the confidence to move quickly and safely, even on slick surfaces. The slip-resistant design is crucial for an environment where quick responses are needed, and stability is a must.

Breathability and Comfort: The ventilated design ensures my feet stay cool and dry, which is a significant plus during long shifts. The shoes are lightweight, too, which minimizes any additional strain on my legs and feet, keeping me focused on my patients rather than discomfort in my feet.

The Crocs LiteRide 360 Pacers have become my go-to work shoe. They blend functionality, comfort, and style in a way that I hadn't found in other footwear. My colleagues have noticed, and several have made the switch themselves after seeing the difference these shoes have made in my workday.

To my fellow healthcare professionals or anyone who spends long hours on their feet, I cannot recommend the Crocs Women's LiteRide 360 Pacer enough. They have significantly impacted my work life by reducing fatigue, providing lasting comfort, and ensuring I can move around safely and quickly. Try them out, and experience the difference for yourself!
title: A Lifesaver for Long Shifts - Crocs LiteRide 360 Pacer Review

pageName: Crocs Women's Literide 360 Pacer W Clog, Almost White Almost White, 6 UK
text:
Play Video
I am a person who doesn't enjoy wearing socks or shoes in general. I prefer bare feet or slides/sandals. That having been said I do own the standard crocs that you can put in sports mode, a slide version of crocs, and the ballerina flats crocs. I decided to add these closed "regular" shoe looking crocs to the mix after liking all the other styles mentioned.

Pros: These shoes are definitely breathable and from a distance look like a normal mesh style tennis shoe. They fit true to size. Light weight.

Cons: They are only semi-comfortable because the arch support/cushioning you get from a classic croc, sandal, or even the flats, you do not get from these. They're also made from the same rubbery material as the crocs for the mesh and it creates an irritating and not great feeling crease over the base of your toes. Lastly, the mesh is very see-through up close so if you wear a sock not the color of the shoe you can see it.

All in all not the worse shoes I've worn but not the best crocs I've worn either. I'm glad I gave them a shot and will continue to wear them until they wear out but won't be purchasing more in the future.
title: Shoe crocs are okay not great.

text: I love these shoes. The first pair I had to return because there was a piece inside by the toe that was sticking up and it was uncomfortable. Of course, it was an easy exchange through Amazon. The second pair were perfect. They are light, roomy, and comfortable, I just wish the arch was a little higher. I do wear footies with these because the bottom has a texture that some people would find therapeutic, but I don't like that feeling. Also, you can see your toes through the mesh top. Besides that, the bottom is nice and squishy, there is almost a bounce when you walk. I got the black pair, and I like the sole color, which goes from gray to light gray, not a shocking white, or all-black. I was concerned about the squeaking. They did squeak at first when I was walking on the kitchen floor, but it quickly went away, so that is not an issue at all. Also, I replaced the shoe laces with stretchy ones with a clip so I have that loafer feel.
title: Very Comfortable No Squeak

text: Bought these ugly Crocs shoes, and suddenly my fashion sense thinks it's starring in a comedy about questionable footwear choices. Slipped them on, and now my feet are channeling their inner fashion rebels, proudly strutting the fine line between comfort and chaos. These Crocs are so unapologetically ugly; I'm convinced they're auditioning for the lead role in a fashion faux pas documentary. If "ugly-chic" were a runway trend, my Crocs would be the avant-garde supermodels. Move over, sleek sneakers; my ugly Crocs just turned my stroll into a catwalk of confusion, leaving onlookers wondering if they're witnessing a fashion statement or a cry for help. Stepping, laughing, and turning every sidewalk into a runway of ridicule – it's the ugly Crocs that are putting the "ugly" in unabashedly ugly footwear!

pageName: Crocs Women's Literide 360 Pacer W Clog, Black Slate Grey, 4 UK
text:
As an ICU registered nurse, my days are long, demanding, and unpredictable. Finding footwear that can keep up with the pace while providing comfort and support throughout my shifts has always been a challenge. That is until I discovered the Crocs Women's LiteRide 360 Pacer.

Comfort and Support: These shoes are a game changer in terms of comfort. The LiteRide foam footbeds are incredibly soft, offering a cushioned ride that feels like walking on clouds, even after 12+ hours on my feet. Their support is unparalleled, ensuring that foot fatigue and soreness are a thing of the past.

Durability and Cleanliness: Working in the ICU means I encounter all sorts of spills and splashes. The LiteRide 360 Pacers' material is not only durable but also easy to clean, which is essential for maintaining hygiene in a healthcare setting. A quick wipe-down is all it takes to keep them looking fresh and ready for another shift.

Slip Resistance and Safety: The traction on these shoes is fantastic, giving me the confidence to move quickly and safely, even on slick surfaces. The slip-resistant design is crucial for an environment where quick responses are needed, and stability is a must.

Breathability and Comfort: The ventilated design ensures my feet stay cool and dry, which is a significant plus during long shifts. The shoes are lightweight, too, which minimizes any additional strain on my legs and feet, keeping me focused on my patients rather than discomfort in my feet.

The Crocs LiteRide 360 Pacers have become my go-to work shoe. They blend functionality, comfort, and style in a way that I hadn't found in other footwear. My colleagues have noticed, and several have made the switch themselves after seeing the difference these shoes have made in my workday.

To my fellow healthcare professionals or anyone who spends long hours on their feet, I cannot recommend the Crocs Women's LiteRide 360 Pacer enough. They have significantly impacted my work life by reducing fatigue, providing lasting comfort, and ensuring I can move around safely and quickly. Try them out, and experience the difference for yourself!
title: A Lifesaver for Long Shifts - Crocs LiteRide 360 Pacer Review

pageName: Crocs Women's Literide 360 Pacer W Clog, Black Slate Grey, 4 UK
text:
Play Video
I am a person who doesn't enjoy wearing socks or shoes in general. I prefer bare feet or slides/sandals. That having been said I do own the standard crocs that you can put in sports mode, a slide version of crocs, and the ballerina flats crocs. I decided to add these closed "regular" shoe looking crocs to the mix after liking all the other styles mentioned.

Pros: These shoes are definitely breathable and from a distance look like a normal mesh style tennis shoe. They fit true to size. Light weight.

Cons: They are only semi-comfortable because the arch support/cushioning you get from a classic croc, sandal, or even the flats, you do not get from these. They're also made from the same rubbery material as the crocs for the mesh and it creates an irritating and not great feeling crease over the base of your toes. Lastly, the mesh is very see-through up close so if you wear a sock not the color of the shoe you can see it.

All in all not the worse shoes I've worn but not the best crocs I've worn either. I'm glad I gave them a shot and will continue to wear them until they wear out but won't be purchasing more in the future.
title: Shoe crocs are okay not great.

text: These fit as expected and are very cute but they are a rubber material with very little give. I wore them one day and they gave me the worst blisters I've ever experienced...on my toes, my heels, and the soles of my feet (I tried with socks at first, then without but that was worse). These are getting returned.
title: Blister City

pageName: Crocs Women's Literide 360 Pacer W Clog, Black Slate Grey, 4 UK
text: I love these shoes. The first pair I had to return because there was a piece inside by the toe that was sticking up and it was uncomfortable. Of course, it was an easy exchange through Amazon. The second pair were perfect. They are light, roomy, and comfortable, I just wish the arch was a little higher. I do wear footies with these because the bottom has a texture that some people would find therapeutic, but I don't like that feeling. Also, you can see your toes through the mesh top. Besides that, the bottom is nice and squishy, there is almost a bounce when you walk. I got the black pair, and I like the sole color, which goes from gray to light gray, not a shocking white, or all-black. I was concerned about the squeaking. They did squeak at first when I was walking on the kitchen floor, but it quickly went away, so that is not an issue at all. Also, I replaced the shoe laces with stretchy ones with a clip so I have that loafer feel.
title: Very Comfortable No Squeak

pageName: Crocs Women's Literide 360 Pacer W Clog, Black Slate Grey, 4 UK
text:
I fit very small (22.5cm Mx) I had a lot of doubts and fears about the size because they mentioned that they came very large, I ordered half a smaller size (bone 22cm) and it looks like I see in the video, the material is resistant, I don't know what the material is but it's like a plastic mesh, only the tab is made of fabric, so it is predicted that they will last a long time and will be easy to wash and will not lose color either, I found it on sale so I had to take advantage of it.
As seen in the video, the material is like a black mesh so let's say you can see everything inside and everyone can see the sock you're wearing and that's all I think it can be an inconvenience for some people sometimes, besides in places where it rains a lot or people who work with liquids or secretions I don't think it's the most convenient footwear
title: Correct size

pageName: Crocs Women's Literide 360 Pacer W Clog, Black Slate Grey, 4 UK
text: Bought these ugly Crocs shoes, and suddenly my fashion sense thinks it's starring in a comedy about questionable footwear choices. Slipped them on, and now my feet are channeling their inner fashion rebels, proudly strutting the fine line between comfort and chaos. These Crocs are so unapologetically ugly; I'm convinced they're auditioning for the lead role in a fashion faux pas documentary. If "ugly-chic" were a runway trend, my Crocs would be the avant-garde supermodels. Move over, sleek sneakers; my ugly Crocs just turned my stroll into a catwalk of confusion, leaving onlookers wondering if they're witnessing a fashion statement or a cry for help. Stepping, laughing, and turning every sidewalk into a runway of ridicule – it's the ugly Crocs that are putting the "ugly" in unabashedly ugly footwear!
title: I LUV IT

pageName: Crocs Women's Literide Pacer Lace-up Sneakers
text: I love these sneakers!! My husband has a black pair and swears by them. I decided to take a chance and I am glad that I did. I am a veterinary assistant and on my feet for at least 10 hours a day. My previously purchased sneakers wore out very quickly. I am not worried about these wearing out fast. I have already put them in the wash a few times. I went with what some reviews said about sizing up. I should not have. I am a size 7 and went up a size. I thought it would be fine since I wear thick socks. Nope, I should have got the size 7. I kept the sneakers because I really needed them and couldn't wait to send back for another pair. Now that I know what size, I plan on ordering more. People are shocked when I tell them they are Crocs. Keep in mind these light color sneakers do get dirty fast. So I am certain that I will get darker colors. I got this color due to being on sale and I could get it sooner. These feel so good on my feet!! I wish Crocs would come out with a pair of sneakers like this without the holes. It's rough when it rains, but that just means I need to take a change of sneakers with me. It is not a big deal. Keep in mind if you work in my field, that you will get urinated on. LOL, it has already happened to me. But I keep extra socks at work and another change of platform Crocs.
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Great for being on feet all day!!

text:
I am dumbfounded by the reviews for this shoe...My whole family recently got some new version of a Croc shoe...everyone raved about how comfortable Crocs were. I've never tried them on before but looking for a comfy new running shoe/shoe for amusement park these popped up as a recommendation on my Amazon account.

First they're unyielding rubber with very low sides and my socks with the shoes pushed my heel out when I walked. Without the socks I'm 110% sure I'd have a blister in moments.

Second the supposed cushion doesn't come close to the softness of any of my running shoes. The rave reviews here made me think I'd be walking on clouds...it was more comparable to the blacktop cushion at a playground.

Third I wear an 8 to an 8.5...because of the reviews I sized down to 8, even though the crocs description said size up the 1/2 step. I have really thin narrow feet so I really thought, again due to the reviews, maybe I should even have gone to a 7...no definitely should have sized UP...

Moral of the story don't buy these stupid shoes...
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
 So uncomfortable I'm angry about it

pageName: Crocs Womens Literide 360 Pacer
text:
As an ICU registered nurse, my days are long, demanding, and unpredictable. Finding footwear that can keep up with the pace while providing comfort and support throughout my shifts has always been a challenge. That is until I discovered the Crocs Women's LiteRide 360 Pacer.

Comfort and Support: These shoes are a game changer in terms of comfort. The LiteRide foam footbeds are incredibly soft, offering a cushioned ride that feels like walking on clouds, even after 12+ hours on my feet. Their support is unparalleled, ensuring that foot fatigue and soreness are a thing of the past.

Durability and Cleanliness: Working in the ICU means I encounter all sorts of spills and splashes. The LiteRide 360 Pacers' material is not only durable but also easy to clean, which is essential for maintaining hygiene in a healthcare setting. A quick wipe-down is all it takes to keep them looking fresh and ready for another shift.

Slip Resistance and Safety: The traction on these shoes is fantastic, giving me the confidence to move quickly and safely, even on slick surfaces. The slip-resistant design is crucial for an environment where quick responses are needed, and stability is a must.

Breathability and Comfort: The ventilated design ensures my feet stay cool and dry, which is a significant plus during long shifts. The shoes are lightweight, too, which minimizes any additional strain on my legs and feet, keeping me focused on my patients rather than discomfort in my feet.

The Crocs LiteRide 360 Pacers have become my go-to work shoe. They blend functionality, comfort, and style in a way that I hadn't found in other footwear. My colleagues have noticed, and several have made the switch themselves after seeing the difference these shoes have made in my workday.

To my fellow healthcare professionals or anyone who spends long hours on their feet, I cannot recommend the Crocs Women's LiteRide 360 Pacer enough. They have significantly impacted my work life by reducing fatigue, providing lasting comfort, and ensuring I can move around safely and quickly. Try them out, and experience the difference for yourself!
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 A Lifesaver for Long Shifts - Crocs LiteRide 360 Pacer Review

pageName: Crocs Womens Literide 360 Pacer
text:
Play Video
I am a person who doesn't enjoy wearing socks or shoes in general. I prefer bare feet or slides/sandals. That having been said I do own the standard crocs that you can put in sports mode, a slide version of crocs, and the ballerina flats crocs. I decided to add these closed "regular" shoe looking crocs to the mix after liking all the other styles mentioned.

Pros: These shoes are definitely breathable and from a distance look like a normal mesh style tennis shoe. They fit true to size. Light weight.

Cons: They are only semi-comfortable because the arch support/cushioning you get from a classic croc, sandal, or even the flats, you do not get from these. They're also made from the same rubbery material as the crocs for the mesh and it creates an irritating and not great feeling crease over the base of your toes. Lastly, the mesh is very see-through up close so if you wear a sock not the color of the shoe you can see it.

All in all not the worse shoes I've worn but not the best crocs I've worn either. I'm glad I gave them a shot and will continue to wear them until they wear out but won't be purchasing more in the future.

pageName: Crocs Womens Literide 360 Pacer
text: I love these shoes. The first pair I had to return because there was a piece inside by the toe that was sticking up and it was uncomfortable. Of course, it was an easy exchange through Amazon. The second pair were perfect. They are light, roomy, and comfortable, I just wish the arch was a little higher. I do wear footies with these because the bottom has a texture that some people would find therapeutic, but I don't like that feeling. Also, you can see your toes through the mesh top. Besides that, the bottom is nice and squishy, there is almost a bounce when you walk. I got the black pair, and I like the sole color, which goes from gray to light gray, not a shocking white, or all-black. I was concerned about the squeaking. They did squeak at first when I was walking on the kitchen floor, but it quickly went away, so that is not an issue at all. Also, I replaced the shoe laces with stretchy ones with a clip so I have that loafer feel.
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Very Comfortable No Squeak

pageName: Crocs Womens Literide 360 Pacer
text: Bought these ugly Crocs shoes, and suddenly my fashion sense thinks it's starring in a comedy about questionable footwear choices. Slipped them on, and now my feet are channeling their inner fashion rebels, proudly strutting the fine line between comfort and chaos. These Crocs are so unapologetically ugly; I'm convinced they're auditioning for the lead role in a fashion faux pas documentary. If "ugly-chic" were a runway trend, my Crocs would be the avant-garde supermodels. Move over, sleek sneakers; my ugly Crocs just turned my stroll into a catwalk of confusion, leaving onlookers wondering if they're witnessing a fashion statement or a cry for help. Stepping, laughing, and turning every sidewalk into a runway of ridicule – it's the ugly Crocs that are putting the "ugly" in unabashedly ugly footwear!
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 I LUV IT

Even wearing socks didn’t help (and it’s hard to feel comfortable getting your feet in the shoe with socks) and I still ended up with open sores on my heels and toes. text: Let me start out by saying that I am comparing to a more expensive and much more comfortable product. I typically by Brooks Sneakers or really running shoes. They are like walking on clouds. I am a fan of Crocs Clogs and have been wanting to try their sneakers. Reviews correctly stated that your ankles WILL hurt if you are not wearing thick socks. The edges are a bit sharp and will cut into your ankles with extended wear IMHO. They otherwise fit well and feel comfortable on my foot. I debated returning them, but decided to keep them to try them out some more. I would not use these for exercise or if I planned to walk a lot, but think they are fine for hanging out or if not walking strenuously for extended periods. I may update the review in the future if my mind changes with extended use. I literally just tried them around the house. Also note that they are somewhat see through at close distance.

text: Very comfortable! Easy to slip on, good style, could run and walk in them for long periods of time. My main issue was staining and the toe fabric would be difficult to clean and would easily darken. When they were cleaned they had a certain smell that I associated with mass produced Chinese products, that cheap plastic manufacturing smell. I would be sure to properly ventilate after cleaning and not let them soak too much water as they dry. The back of the shoe had also become worn and damaged where it started to get torn and fall apart. These shoes lasted about a year with almost daily wear.

My width is B my size 7.5 thats what I bought and they feel great on.
I put them in my clothes washer on delicate, and they washed up perfectly.

I would recomend these shoes to all my friends.

text: I am the one on any trip with a foot or shoe issue. text: I am a 46-year-old stay at home mom who decided it was time to buy some supportive sneakers because I am on my feet a lot of the day. I was very pleased with how the Dr Scholl looked and fit and was willing to pay the price for what I thought would be better quality shoes. But I am so disappointed that in less than six months, they have already begun to fall apart; cracks in the shoe, and the rubber around the toe is separating. I do wear them almost every day, but the extent of my activity is walking around my house, up and down the stairs, around the block with my kids, shopping, etc. I paid more money to purchase what I thought was a better quality shoe, but they did not last any longer than what I could buy from Walmart for less than half the price. I really like these shoes and would gladly take a free replacement pair from the company, but I do not think I will buy the brand again.

So I thought they would be perfect to wear for a week long event where I would be walking a lot each day. While the sneakers are cute and felt overall comfortable when standing, these absolutely destroyed my feet with blisters. By the third/fourth day of wearing them and walking only 5,000-6,000 steps per day, I had horrific blisters on the back of my heel and on the sides of my feet and pinky toes. I ended up throwing out the shoes in the hotel and not bringing them home with me because of how much pain these shoes ended up causing.

I never write reviews, however I was so disappointed in these shoes, especially with all of the great reviews guaranteeing you can walk 30,000 steps a day comfortably, that I had to leave this review.

pageName: Geox Women's D Spherica Sneakers
text:
I gave these sneakers to my girlfriend in white and these are her comments: -They are very nice to wear in summer, as they match all clothes.

-The size corresponds well to reality. It is a summer boot for walking, to be worn without socks or with very thin socks, so it is recommended to take the same number as you wear and not a larger number. In the case of my girlfriend, she uses 38 in summer sandals and this is the number I took from these sneakers and they fit her like a glove.
-They are reinforced on the heel, with a layer of leather that gives them a very elegant look.
-They have an insole and a sole that make the tread very comfortable, as it gives them excellent cushioning. Highly recommended for people with foot problems and pain.
-They are very flexible.
-They are breathable.
-They can be washed comfortably in the washing machine (in our case, we have washed them 4 times before the photos, which are shown at 30ºC and 1200 rpm and are still as good as new).
Highly recommended!
title: VERY LIGHT SNEAKERS THAT CAN BE COMBINED WITH SUMMER CLOTHES

pageName: Geox Women's D Spherica a Sneaker, 8 US
text:
I gave these sneakers to my girlfriend in white and these are her comments: -They are very nice to wear in summer, as they match all clothes.

-The size corresponds well to reality. It is a summer boot for walking, to be worn without socks or with very thin socks, so it is recommended to take the same number as you wear and not a larger number. In the case of my girlfriend, she uses 38 in summer sandals and this is the number I took from these sneakers and they fit her like a glove.
-They are reinforced on the heel, with a layer of leather that gives them a very elegant look.
-They have an insole and a sole that make the tread very comfortable, as it gives them excellent cushioning. Highly recommended for people with foot problems and pain.
-They are very flexible.
-They are breathable.
-They can be washed comfortably in the washing machine (in our case, we have washed them 4 times before the photos, which are shown at 30ºC and 1200 rpm and are still as good as new).
Highly recommended!
title: VERY LIGHT SNEAKERS THAT CAN BE COMBINED WITH SUMMER CLOTHES

pageName: Geox Women's D Spherica a Sneaker, 8 US
text:
I bought a pair of white ones last April. Admittedly, it was a bit difficult for me to pay so much for plastic shoes, but they are absolutely worth the price. It's like walking on clouds, the sole is extremely well cushioned, even now with a heel spur, these are the most comfortable shoes, and I have some good ones.
Unfortunately, an eyelet for the shoelace has now been torn out, but I also wore it a lot and it could be repaired. But since I have to wear insoles permanently now anyway, I ordered them one size larger, and in grey, the white ones got grubby too quickly, but I easily washed them several times in the machine.
My plastic fears are gone, no matter what kind of socks or booties, no sweaty feet, no vegetables, even on hot days, that surprised me very positively.
title: Great shoe

pageName: Skechers Women's D'Lites Fresh Start Memory Foam Lace-up Sneaker Fashion
text:
As someone with extremely flat feet and a history of plantar fasciitis, finding comfortable shoes has always been a challenge for me. However, my experience with the white Skechers has been nothing short of amazing. From the moment I slipped them on, it felt like walking on clouds.

These shoes have become my go-to footwear, especially when traveling. Whether I'm standing in long airport lines or exploring new cities on foot, I know I can rely on these Skechers for unparalleled comfort and support. They have truly been a game-changer for my feet.

Not only are they incredibly comfortable, but they also boast a fashionable design that pairs well with any outfit. I've received countless compliments on their sleek white look.

If you're looking for a stylish yet comfortable shoe that can withstand long hours of standing and walking, look no further than the white Skechers. They have significantly minimized my foot pain and have become an essential part of my wardrobe. Highly recommended!

text:
I have two pairs of these shoes and they are so easy to get on and off and they are comfortable! I do recommend going up a half size on the shoes or a whole size. I wear a 9 and my black ones in these shoes are a 9.5 and my gray ones are a 10. They fit similar to many of my ‘normal size’ shoes.

I have washed the gray ones many times as they are a light color so show dirt more and since these are my go to shoes they get dirty. They wash up looking like brand new. I even take a magic eraser to the sides and bottoms to really make them look new.

Definitely recommend!

text: I own another pair of these, different color size 6.5, and LOVE them! Very comfortable and have held up well. I purchased these is the same size, 6.5, and they didn't fit, could not get them on my feet. So I returned and ordered a size 7, these are too loose. I would order a 6.5w to try but sadly they are out of stock. I've kept the 7 so 4 stars.

text: These are comfortable for a couple of hours and than you feel there's not enough cushion. I put in slim gel inserts and it help,but, don't put thick ones in or your foot is now higher than the shoe and your foot comes out.

pageName: Skechers Women's BOBS Skipper Tide Pool Sneaker
text: These are great looking shoes and slip on and off pretty easily. I was hoping that paying a bit more would insure that the support would be better but that is not the case. I wear them at work all day and the toe box support gives out after about 4 hours. Still good in the heel though. The fabric has held it's shape and color well and the soul looks good.
